Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: PTLondonSW
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights in this hotel in Berlin. The location is great: about 10 minutes from Alexanderplatz and Museum Island, and very quiet, It's about 50m from Markisches Museum station so also well connected for getting to Potsdamer Platz and restaurants in Franzosiche Strausse. Definitely worth wandering round the area and going to the museum. Nice walks along the river. The staff were great. I particularly valued the reception staff who went out of their well to be welcoming ( let me check in early, for example) and followed through until I was off site (I booked an early taxi at 5.45 for the airport and was, predicatably, early so they rang the taxi people and hurried it up). Simple clean unfussy and comfortable rooms. Some people won't appreciate the adulation of the dollar! The restaurants, bars and mini-bars are a bit over-priced but there are other options nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, big room - but SLOW INTERNET!”
Reviews.Author: Steven G
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, the room was really big and perfect - everything you could ask for. The location wasn't fantastic. However it is close to a lot of touristy areas such as the museum district. My only complaint was the internet was terrible. Hardly ever worked and kept dropping out every minute or so. Was really dissapointed as I ended up up-grading and paying extra for faster internet and it still was really crap. Would have expected a refund on the internet... or at least offer internet that WORKS!!! however overall the hotel was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: rosesr4ever
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Park Plaza Wallstreet from April 8 til April 12. The hotel was nicely decorated. Everything of course had something to do with the wallstreet theme, that includes the huge wallpaper behind the front desk in the lobby: 3 seemngly ecstatic men, looking up at dollar bills falling down from the sky. Hilarious at first. Apart from that, decoration is simple and classy. Rooms were very nice, with custom made drawers and closets. The bathroom would have been perfect if not for the absurd "decorative" 15 cm gap between both glass panels that are supposed to stop water from dripping outside the tub rather than helping it escape. One other noteworthy detail, the room is much smaller than what it looks like online. And the king bed is actually 2 beds brought together, can get very inconvenient at times. However, breakfast is great and varied, even despite its exorbitant price, and food at the bar is awesome, tastiest food I had during my stay in Berlin! Drinks are okay too. Staff is super helpful and nice, everything was crisp clean, rooms heated... All in all, I really enjoyed my stay and would most probably go back one day.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: kuwait08
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and comfortable; overall the staff was helpful and courteous--a few times we encountered rudeness at the front desk, but we were there a week. the bar is very nice, the couches and chairs on the street-side great for conversation; the food is nothing special. there is a tiny restaurant with a liimited menu; again, food is nothing special. One great thing at this hotel is its proximity to the underground, which will take you anywhere in berlin! Otherwise, the location is not close to anything much. Overall, I would stay here if I were more interested in price and a good night's sleep than a view or being able to walk to the sights. Actually, Berlin was a much better experience than I expected-the museums are well-done overall, and brimming with iunexpected, interesting and amazing things to see. the underground is a great way to get everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: SDPUK
Reviews.Content: The room we had was a decent size (for European standards) and the decor was pleasantly different and tasteful. I would love to have their carpet in my office! The staff at the hotel were very courteous and spoke very good English. Especially the intern from Holland, Niginia, who was very friendly and helpful at all times and always had a smile on her face. The hotel was clean and the rooms were spotless. Our room was cleaned daily to a high standard. The staff even helped my wife (via email) to order some cake for my birthday and have it in our room as a surprise. Breakfast at the hotel is a little bit pricy. We always ate at "Milly's Cafe" around the corner, which can be found enroute to Alexandar Platz. WiFi at the hotel was easy to access, although the username and password changes every 24hrs so you have to go to reception to obtain the new details. We landed at TXL and took the bus to Ernst-Reuter-Platz and jumped on the U-Bhan to SpittelMarkt. The hotel is literally a 5 minute walk from here. The hotel is between SpittelMarkt and Markisches-Museum (which is a little closer) This was a much quicker route than taking a bus to Alexander Platz and walking/u-bhan from there. The costs are the same and there are less tourists with luggage on the route we took. We felt really safe walking around Berlin at all times of the day and late at night, including the area where the hotel is. We generally walked everywhere in Berlin and the hotel is in a great location within walking distance of everything: 10-15 mins to Alexandar Platz 10-15 mins to Museum Island 30-40 mins to Brandenburg Gate I would definitely recommend anyone visiting Berlin to stay here (business or pleasure) as its in a quite location, but not too far from all the attractions. We will surely book here again when we return to Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Hip and trendy!”
Reviews.Author: kklasen
Reviews.Content: Very tasteful and fresh architecture planted into a typical historic Berlin housing complex. Attractive room interior and definitely good value for money for business and leisure as well! Nice and youthful service people with a definite feeling how to treat international guests! Good location at the fringe of the "Stadtmitte".

Reviews.Title: “Don't look further than this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Donna C
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at both of the Park Plaza Hotels - Wallstreet and Storkower. They are without doubt both excellent hotels with staff that go above and beyond with the big and little things that help your stay even better. The Wallstreet Park Plaza is stylish and full of character in design. It is in the perfect location only two stops from Alexanderplatz and public transport a few metres away. Just don't expect a beautiful view of the city - but you can have a lovely view of the charming courtyard and bits of the city but this is downtown in the heart of things. The hotel is big enough but not too big that you are lost and just a number so don't look any further - stay at the Park Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for City Break and Museums”
Reviews.Author: Indo_Korean
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in a comfy double bed room, with excellent bathroom. All facilities were of high standard. The hotel was very clean and also quiet throughout. We did not spend much time in the hotel other than at night, but our experience overall was a very good one - the staff were very helpful and welcoming. On a couple of occasions the staff went out of their way to help and make sure our needs were met. The location is perfect for access to the U-bahn underground and also 10mins walk to the Museum Island. There are a few very good cafes and bars within 10-15mins walk too. Would use again and recommended for couples, friends and business.

Reviews.Title: “A Really Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: paradiselost38
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ideal for us for a three night stay in February. The general atmosphere was warm, relaxed and welcoming. The hotel has spacious public areas and our experience reflects the comments of other recent guests, plenty of space, comfy bed, large bathroom, loads of light, tea and coffee making facilities in our room and overlooking a pleasant large public courtyard. Exceptional value for money. The location is very close to the river with easy access to underground and main central areas. The neighbourhood is very peaceful and pleasant. Staff very nice too. Cannot fault this hotel, we had a really lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend in Berlin with the kids”
Reviews.Author: Mirinda I
Reviews.Content: The Park Plaza Wallstreet Hotel in Berlin is in a word fantastic and great value for money. Very friendly staff, super location. The rooms are large and luxurious. We had a family suite, which was two bedrooms with a large bathroom with shower, bath and toilet and double sink. There was also a second toilet and wash hand basin in the kids room. The breakfast buffet was full of fresh breads, warm eggs, fruit, cheeses, coldmeats and fish. I would certainly recommend this hotel for couples, families and business people. We visited in February and Berlin was very cold, so we didn't get to do that much outside. Great reason to go back in the summer when we will definitely at the Park Plaza Wallstreet again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel ,well situated”
Reviews.Author: Grant C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parl Plaza Wallstreet in some of the coldest weather of the year, but our stay was great. The rooms are very spacious, nicely furnished and very comfortable. The staff are very helpful and speak very good English. The hotel is warm and welcoming. The wall street theme is so nicely done without being tacky. Nice details like the dollar bill paper habkerchieves. In only a few minutes you can be in the real centre of Berlin , but inside the hotel there is no noise at all. Only one criticism , on the TV there are no entertainment channels in English - just endless news channels. Maybe a film or something would be nice.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, and comfortable with fun theme and great location!”
Reviews.Author: debbiesdreamtrips
Reviews.Content: I researched the heck out of Berlin hotels and, thanks to reviews by other TripAdvisor travelers, found this gem! Here were my takeaways from my stay in May 29th and 30th, 2011. I hope this feedback is as helpful to you as other reviewers posts were for me. :-) Accommodations-- I was so impressed with every aspect of the accommodations in this hotel. It was SUPER clean and had very stylish, modern decor. The Wall Street theme was a trip! As an American visiting Europe for the first time (and staying in Berlin on the last two days of our eleven day journey), it was comforting to see George Washington's face on the dollar bill carpeting on the floor. LOL! It was fun but also tastefully done and not overpowering or hokey. Even with as modern as the furnishings were (sometimes modern = uncomfortable), the accommodations were wonderful! The bed was super comfortable, had a great comforter, and nice pillows. You won't be disappointed with the great night's sleep you'll get. The bathroom was sleek and stylish-- and HUGE! The shower had plenty of hot water and great water pressure. I also soaked in the deep tub one night after a long day of walking around the city. It was just what I needed for my aching muscles. Such a great hotel to come "home" to on our trip. Service The front desk attendants were absolutely amazing. They were so polished and professional and really went above and beyond to make sure we were comfortable. They gave us special access codes to the internet for free wi-fi and were super helpful in directing us how best to get around town. On our last day there, they made sure we knew best how to get to the bus stop that would get us to the airport easiest. Seriously fantastic service!!! I will also note that upon our return to the States, we actually got a bill in the mail for $25 for the mini-bar, which we did not use. I emailed the Park Plaza Wallstreet Berlin Hotel to dispute the charges and the manager removed the charges immediately and refunded my credit card instantly. She was extremely apologetic for the oversight on the part of their housekeeping staff and took care of us right away. I don't mind oversights... it happens... it is how they are dealt with and this property proved again that their service was top-notch and extremely professional. Great people! Location The hotel is located in a quiet, safe part of town and close to the Alexanderplatz area. There is a subway station SUPER close to the hotel, so getting around town was easy and convenient. Best of all, we felt really safe getting back to our hotel late at night. Amenities My hubby took advantage of the 24-hour gym and really loved that they had a sauna to give him a relaxing post-workout experience. While we didn't take advantage of the hotel restaurant or bar, we saw others enjoying good food, drinks, and conversation in those dining areas. Pics I posted some photos of our wonderful room and hope this review and the pics help you to realize that you can't go wrong with this fantastic hotel! I kick myself for wasting so much time researching any other hotels after reading the great reviews about this one. It was a fantastic experience and, on future trips to Berlin, I would stay there again without thinking twice! Safe travels to you and yours!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with awful toilet!!”
Reviews.Author: mikkomax
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with a good central location. Horrible see-through toilets...

Reviews.Title: “third time guest”
Reviews.Author: Marc W
Reviews.Content: great hotel, central location, 10 - 15 min walk to alexander platz and Musuem island sites. spotlessly clean and very friendly and professional staff. Would thoroughly recommend a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Average on every level, unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: NHgoodwin
Reviews.Content: We tend to be easy-going travelers, but our toilet broke the night before our departure and nothing was done to help the situation. There were no extra rooms, no one was around to fix it, no discount was offered, and we left as fast as we could the next morning. The rooms were gaudy and small with cheap furnishings. The stairwells and bathrooms were lovely, but this place is trying too hard. The location is all right in that you can walk to Friedrichstrasse, but there are closer hotels for a better price. The street is empty most of the time and the walk from the U-Bahn can be unnerving, especially at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for seeing the sights!”
Reviews.Author: Tashy30
Reviews.Content: We arrived to a very pleasant front of house staff who checked us in and was helpful. The room was a nice size and clean. Like the decor. The en-suite was clean and a good size. The location of this hotel was great. In walking distance of the underground tube, we didn't really bother and walked everywhere as it wasn't an issue for us. Probably say about 20mins or so to the East Side Gallery. Roughly the same to the rest of the attractions, give or take 10mins. Buses are local aswell, so no problem there. There is a bar in the hotel which is ok price wise, although we had a bit of an issue with one of the bar staff who wasn't particularly friendly, but hey! There is a really nice Indian restaurant just round the corner from the hotel which was great value for money. Great bars around the TV Tower, one I can't remember the proper name of but is has a sign outside saying 'No 1 XXXXX in Mitte' traditional bar with great German Beer. Overall, a great trip and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: The hotel is still great in location, price and design. There is an U-Bahn station a minutes walk from the front door. The room was extremely attractive and well-equipped, especially considering the price. There was coffee and tea in the room. Breakfast excellent (although expensive when paid extra, something that did not happen, because they had a promotion that included breakfast) There was a bit of noise in the morning from people walking in the room upstairs. Bathroom leaks & unable to connect wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for city sightseeing!”
Reviews.Author: nikomar
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend in Berlin and stayed in this hotel. Its location is really good, very quiet, but close to Alexander Platz and numerous attractions in its vicinity. Two metro stations are literally 2 minutes walk from hotel's entrance. The staff was friendly and welcoming. Our room (standard) was really nice, with more than enough place for two adults. I really liked it's distinctive interior, with spa-style glass decoration in the bathroom, interesting bed design and high ceilings and huge windows. Beds are more than comfortable, meaning one can really recharge the batteries for another long sightseeing day in this magnificent city. The only downside (if I can name it like that) consisted in the fact our room had a connecting door with another room. Now, this shouldn't be a problem. But you can imagine the noise coming from a screaming child, in the middle of night. Thus, don't expect good sound isolation in this hotel. Finally, the building is really nice. However, you may easily get lost, trying to find the way to your room or the elevator. Their wall signs are not that clear and it is not an ordinary hotel, with typical room composition. To sum it up, anybody planning an intense visit to Berlin can be pretty much sure this hotel will be an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely city-break hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kit32
Reviews.Content: The staff here were very friendly and thankfully spoke very good English. I was here for a short city break with a friend and found the location great and the rooms lovely and clean. The bathroom fell just slightly short of expectations due to the frosted glass doors which didn't really meet each other and left little to privacy when it came to 'noise'. The towels were a tad on the small side too. Having said that, I would definitely choose to stay here again. The journey from Tegal airport took about half an hour and cost around €20. The underground and bus network is very easy to follow (even when we were thrown off for 'engineering works') and having the hotel on the main tube line that runs through the city was a definite plus. The Christmas markets were great for food and handmade crafts. You can see nearly all of them in a short trip and still have time for sightseeing and shopping. A useful point to note is that there is a small cafe "Millys" close to the hotel (right out of the front doors, first road on the left) which serves a good breakfast at a rate far cheaper than the hotel. It is also next door to a supermarket if you need any essential goods. This hotel was recommended to me and I would certainly do the same for friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: suzanne m
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location just south of the river- you can see 2 tube stops from the door, and the areas of Gendarmenmarkt (a must) and Nicolaikirchplatz both a 10 minute walk. The main museums are a 15 minute walk away as well. The staff are friendly and very helpful. The rooms are clean and confortable and very quiet. The bar is lively and welcoming with good service. Great value for money as well.

Reviews.Title: “Take Stock of "Park Plaza" Wall St.”
Reviews.Author: micheal7
Reviews.Content: resided this hotel for 2 nights December 2011, I rate the hotel as excellent value for money, Staff at reception were very helpful, and spoke excellent English. Gave help and advise willingly and were pleasant mannered, not always case in Germany. Printed off boarding cards for us prior to departure Hotel is on a quiet street, very little traffic. Ubahn Station, "Markhets Mueseum" is 100 paces (counted) from the front door, another station 300 meters in opposite direction is on same line. We were in room 207 on second floor, it was totally silent till 7.30 am when a few person could be heard passing down hallway. Room was bright and modern, not large, toilet and bathroom were clean bright and modern. Our double bed had individual duvets. Rooms safe, and coffee, making free. Was pleased to see 2 bottles of water and small bottle of red wine on table, on closer inspection €5 each, fridge bar normal hotel prices. Staff did not start cleaning rooms at least in this part of hotel till after 11am so it was possible to have lie on if arrival on late flight. Room was heated by radiators, under windows, (air con summer only) Tip ....regulators on radiators in bathroom and bedroom to regulate the heat (was way too hot) Hotel bar was bright and very well stocked, staff were helpful and attentive. prices were as Dublin bar prices. Arrived back to Hotel on both nights at 11.20pm, there were 10 to 15 people in bar and lots of chat going on. Drinks were well presented, lots of ice, mixers in bottles, tall glasses for shorts, ect. Group of business men got several plates of nuts which others about did not. I feel they were complimentary but maybe not. Underground station small and very easy to use. "Alexander Platz" 2nd stop, on line on right as one arrives from hotel. Leipseiger ( at other end street near Spittlemarket Ubahn stn) a lots of shops ect and led down to best Christmas markets at Glendermarket. Did not have meals at hotel, 17 € for breakfast so can not comment,

Reviews.Title: “Friendly”
Reviews.Author: fkp052628
Reviews.Content: I was in Berlin for a business trip. This was the first time I stayed in this hotel. I noticed that the staff is very friendly. You do not see that everywhere.The room was clean and enough space to work. I enjoyed the breakfast. I had some free time to explore the city sights and the staff gave me some good advices.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: s00
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous place to stay ,rooms were great ,staff helpful and breakfast good. We didnt need the internet so had no problems with that.When we arrived late on the evening of 2nd December the reception was busy but the staff were polite and helpful. We too had an upgrade , but although our room on the first floor faced the street we found no problems with that. The U Bahn runs under the street but again this didnt cause us problems but maybe if you thought it might ask for a room on a higher floor. The rooms were clean and spacious ,with free toiletries and coffee machine. Ideally placed between two U Bahn stations we had easy access to all historic sites. we liked the lobby area and the bar it was bright and modern. The bar staff were very helpful. All in all a good experience and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: nyctravelalot
Reviews.Content: Park Plaza Wallstreet Berlin is one of those places that has on the face of it a lot going for it. A great location right next to a U Bahn station, good rates and big modern fun rooms. The lobby is nothing special and the bar area kind of ugly in that cold Ikea modern way. The elevator is decidedly slow. The hotel is a converted old courtyard building and should somehow be very charming and cozy: but isn't. Or at least I didn't find it to be. My three grievances are, in no particular order: they offer: "free Internet" as a marketing ploy, when you book the room. OK free Internet is a good thing and something essential to me as I am always uploading pictures and online or streaming videos that I might want to post, etc. I won't stay in a hotel if internet isn't included. Well what you quickly discover when you log onto the the free Internet is that it is basic Internet. So you really can't stream videos and to upload 4 pictures it took 15 minutes and if you uploaded too many you got a warning message saying you have reached your data quota (or some such thing). And to get proper actual working Internet it was 15 Euro a day ($20.36). Which the first several times I tried to buy it I was not able to as I kept getting error messages. And when I asked the front desk they said: sorry we don't control that it is done by an outside company so you have to call them. I did. They didn't understand the error message either, but in the end when I paid for it on my credit card instead of to my room it worked fine. And was very quick and allowed me to do everything I needed. So, not a hotel for business. Here is another example of why this isn't a hotel to stay in if you need to get anything done: A friend bought me a "pay as you go phone" so I would save some money while in Germany and as a birthday present. She brought it by on the afternoon of the 11th. The front desk of the hotel made no effort what so ever to contact me to say: hey you have something at the front desk. When I went downstairs to ask if they had something for me I was told: We are very busy and can't find it now can you come back Monday? (This was Saturday) I could not. So I waited until they found it (took all of three minutes). I stayed here at the start and end of my trip and I was both times just down the hall from the 5th floor elevator. First time across from a slamming fire door next time adjacent to the fire door which every time it closed slammed causing my door to rattle. Every banging foot going up and down the hall wall reverberated in my room. Every word spoke was crystal clear in my room. Unlike most hotels there is no little hall way with a bathroom off of it to buffer sound. Similar issues occurred with people dragging their luggage through the courtyard. The executive room was lovely, but why stay in an executive room in a hotel that makes it near impossible for you to do work (or in my case get a good nights sleep) I'd pass on this one even at the great rate I got it wasn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: simon h
Reviews.Content: booked by my wonderful wife as a suprise birthday present,this is a brilliant hotel in a quiet side street. 50 yards from 2 tube stations or a nice walk into the centre of berlin. the room was very nice and beds comfortable.large enough for two people and a nice big bathroom. the food was top class and staff very friendly and extremely helpful,nothing was too much of a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the stay!”
Reviews.Author: rodrigot
Reviews.Content: It's an honest hotel, new and clean. Staff are polite and prestative. The location is not the best, but it's a 10 min walk from Alexanderplatz and Friedrichstrase.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: StephanAkker
Reviews.Content: Last weekend we stayed in the Wall Street hotel in Berlin. A great hotel with a wunderfall staff and service. the hotel is also good situated within a small distance of the Berlin best places. I will book again when I visit Berlin next time. The breakfast could be a little bit better. When showing up late they could refill the buffet. But when we asked fot it they provided us with new fresh food.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, decent location at a good price”
Reviews.Author: surfKiev
Reviews.Content: I picked this place based on reviews, price and location. The place was on a quite street and we walked to all the sites we wanted to see. I wouldn't call the location central, but it was fine with us. The room itself was quite comfortable and clean with cool design. The beds are nice and I liked the glass bathroom. Free Wall Street Journals here! The staff was helpful and friendly. For the value minded traveler I would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Good value city hotel for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: nickandtash
Reviews.Content: For a short weekend trip, it was absolutely fine. Reception staff were really helpful and friendly. House keeping not so great, we returned one day at about 5 to find the room uncleaned, it also took about an hour and several calls to get an ironing board and iron. Location, is a little bit out of the centre but really close to 2 underground stations so was fine. If I visited again, I would prefer to stay in Prenzlaur Berg, its a gorgeous area with a park, tonnes of restaurants and little trendy shops or Hackeshe Hof which is a bit more trendy in an east london type of way. Food, never ate at the hotel so can't comment but breakfast room looked nice, we had amazing dinners in several different areas in berlin,so explore well if your a foodie. If you are arriving late (which we did) and don't have time to travel, there is a great little tapas place in a courtyard at the back of the hotel, the kitchen was officially closed but they made us a great dinner and were really really friendly, plus its very pretty court yard setting. Rooms, we stayed in a twin on the top floor, no bath, very compact but they have everything you need for a city break where you literally sleep in it.

Reviews.Title: “Apart from the bizarre theme....”
Reviews.Author: glasshalffull123
Reviews.Content: If you were refurbishing a hotel round about 2008-2011, you might think about any identifier that you could use. If you were in a street in Berlin called Wallstrasse (meaning rampart), then you might briefly consider a Wall Street/Greed is Good theme. But then you would think again as the bankers' recklessness has plunged the world into recession (admittedly not Germany). Except at this one they didn't think again. Offensive photo backdrop at recession of white-haired suited men, orgasmic at money raining down on them. My room carpet was actually a giant dollar bill. I will try to post photos as I was stunned into horrified silence. Apart from that the hotel is lovely, clean, big, well-served. Just try to avoid looking at the capitalist hubris of their theme.

Reviews.Title: “Poor facilites for businesswomen”
Reviews.Author: LondonThelma
Reviews.Content: Like so many city centre hotels, this one does not cater for businesswomen, nor can it handle large groups arriving. Not enough staff on front desk, no concierge to help advise on tourist attractions, and despite emailing in advance and a promise from reception, was given a room without a bath. New room so small can reach both walls whilst lying in bed. No shower cap, cottonwool, hangars suitable for delicate fabrics, no safe, no chain lock on door, no peep hole, no fridge, no minibar, no kettle or tea and coffeemaking facilities, no place to put suitcase to unpack, apart from the bed - the list is endless. Why don't these hotels ask a businesswoman to give feedback on their rooms?

Reviews.Title: “Stay at this hotel in oktober”
Reviews.Author: Peter V
Reviews.Content: Togheter with my team we had a stay in this hotel for 3 days. Fabelous breakfast Very nice bar Cool rooms Correct service We liked our stay al lot and will choose this hotel again when we go back to Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, would definitely recommend.”
Reviews.Author: MegMcD12
Reviews.Content: The Park Plaza is in a perfect location as it is right next to a U2 stop and just a couple stops away from Alexanderplatz. The rooms were very clean and had a really nice bathroom. The bathroom and bedroom had both been renovated and seemed very updated and clean. Everything about our stay here was pleasant. There was also free wifi that worked really well in the rooms. The staff was very friendly and helpful as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mike100274
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quiet, clean and overall just nice... good for the price. They also allow dogs, but they won't let you leave them in the room alone (even if the dog is crate trained, like ours). The hotel is just outside Alexanderplatz so the noise with the tourist area isn't there. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Hotel, friendly efficient staff, great stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: amvs
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Park Plaza this July. Rooms were clean, bathrooms large, beds were comfortable and cozy, and staff were friendly and helpful. Only a few minutes walk to the U2 underground station. Small market nearby for snacks etc. Unter den Linden, Gendermenmarket, Museuminsel are all within an easy walk. Nice bar and restaurant on the property. Staff were very helpful with getting tickets to the Rienstag as you now need to apply online for entrance tickets. Apparantly just changed this summer but staff were very helpful with securing tickets for us. Parking was very easy and reasonable as well. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Berlin and would stay here again when we return to Europe.

Reviews.Title: “berlin”
Reviews.Author: neil g
Reviews.Content: we spent 3 nights in this clean friendly hotel, i minute from the u2 line, fairly new, large bathroom, beds comfortable, several restaurants & bars near by, nice walk by the river spree.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, efficient staff, relaxed atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Tima-London
Reviews.Content: This one (four days end of September/beginning of October) was my second stay at this hotel. I came back as the location of the hotel is hard to beat at the price for a long-weekender tourist: U2 underground station is literally 1 minut walk, Gendarmenmarkt, Museuminsel, Unter den Linden are within easy walking distance. The room was clean and had a nice, minimalist, modern feel about it. Early check-in was not a probem with the reception and I must point out that they also have some green credentials: the sauna is open from 6am to 10pm but you need to let them know if you would like to use it as the system is not in operation all the time. This was pointed out to me right at the time of arrival, so when I phoned at 6.40am the response was that the sauna will be ready in 20 minutes. And it was - very efficient. The rooms and the surroundings are very quiet. I liked the firmness of the matress in the bed - for me a must-have for a good sleep. I do not bother buying breakfast from a hotel nowadays because of the extortinate prices all of them tend to charge for it. Of course it is nice to take the lift down to the restaurant in the morning, read the paper and have a croissant and coffee without leaving the hotel. However, if it is not raining, one can stroll to Housevogteiplatz or Gendarmenmarkt and eat there ... But it is everyone's own call. In the evenings ... I could not locate a pub in the immediate vicinity of the hotel but this is when easy access to the underground has its benefits again. You can enjoy the beer in the Prater beer garden in Prenzlauer Berg and still be in the hotel within 15 minutes after you have left Eberwalder Strasse (subsitute the drinking hole with anothe establishment along U2 line). The net is that this is a relaxed, quiet, very efficiently run hotel in a great location from the perspective of a tourist - no pressure on the guests but if you have a request, the staff will go to great lengths to deliver. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable with a friendly atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: NineEighteen
Reviews.Content: The hotel seems quite new, the theme is money, this being Wallstreet. The carpets in the corridors are stock tickers and the theme is carried into the bedrooms. The bed was surprisingly comfortable considering that it felt quite firm when I first sat on it. The bathroom was quite funky with a glass sided shower cubicle/wet room towards the centre of the room. We used the hotel bar and restaurant. The bar was relaxed and comfortable and the restaurant was excellent. The only negative would be that there's not too much variety on the menu but I guess that works well when you consider that most will only use it once at most during a trip. Free wifi is available. The location is good, it's a quiet part of town but very close to a couple of U-Bahn stations for easy access to the rest of Berlin and it's very close to the site of the former Berlin Wall so many of the buildings nearby are relatively new. Checkpoint Charlie is a short walk away. Overall I recommend the hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fiona4333
Reviews.Content: We have just returned home from staying in this hotel in Berlin. I would recommend this as a place to stay and would definitely stay there again! Our room was spacious, extremely clean and comfortable! The shower was great and we also had a large double bath! In fact the bathroom was huge!!!! We didn't eat in the hotel but the food choices looked good and also reasonable. We were going to have a glass of wine one night in the bar before we went out but it was ridiculously expensive! I'd give that a miss to be honest! The location of the hotel was good. It is only a stones throw away from the U Bahn station which can get you to everywhere that you want to go....it is also walkable to the centre if you fancy the trek!

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre hotel with poor restuarant”
Reviews.Author: Wicketdog
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel through an offer with an online coupon company. We found the hotel itself to be a bit of a let down, it could have been much more inviting and homely, instead everything was white and there was no decoration apart from the dollar-patterned carpets. The meal offer was atrocious, do not go for any of their meal offers! The starter was soup - basically a dissolved chicken stock cube, the main was a choice of sausage or schnitzel, both of which were pork, no options for vegetarians or non pork eaters. The desert was vanilla ice cream. The breakfast had a good range of food, and champagne was available, which was a bonus! The location is ok, quite close to Alexander Platz, but a long way from the main shopping areas and tourist sites. It is quite noisy if it is warm and you sleep with your windows open, we faced the inner courtyard, so there shouldn't have been any noise, but from 6am you could here them setting up breakfast and then people having meetings in the courtyard, so no good for a lie in!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Colin R
Reviews.Content: Checked in here early morning Friday 2 September and found that our standby upgrade to a junior suite had been approved. Room was huge, spotlessly clean. All hotel areas were light, airy and clean. Staff were unfailingly polite and helpful, even down to recommending somewhere to have lunch and providing us with a parking pass for the street. Hotel is in a quiet area right next to Markishches Museum U-Bahn station, a mere two stops to Alexanderplatz. Parking is also abundant in the area. This hotel has my strong recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room and staff!”
Reviews.Author: Carmela
Reviews.Content: The room and hotel was clean and the staff was very helpful and friendly. The room was large, had a lovely bed and excellent bath/shower. The location is convenient and it is also just steps away from the U-bahn.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - will definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: Anne M
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel on our first ever trip to Berlin. We will definitely be back to both the city and the hotel. The hotel is situated in a lovely old building with quirky decor and character. The rooms were well appointed and very comfortable with little luxury touches like the Nespresso coffee machines. Breakfast was delicious with lots of choices to suit everyone. We had lunch and dinner one day too and both were good. Overall everything was good value and the hotel was within walking distance of Berlin's main museums and a handy underground station.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Biryani
Reviews.Content: Convenient location. My first time in Berlin & I was easily able to get around from hotel by walking or using public transport...bus & metro close by. Single room was on top floor & only a large single bed. AC worked well & I needed it during my stay. Room was OK but quite small; breakfast was plentiful & good; reception staff helpful. I did not use fitness centre.

Reviews.Title: “Fanstastic hotel in Berlin - will definitely come back”
Reviews.Author: Ray N
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel with great value for money, excellent location and very friendly and helpful staff. I have stayed at this hotel twice in the past 12 months and wouldn't want to look anywhere else. It is close to two U Bahn stations both on to your right and left as you walk out the hotel and they are literally a minute or two away. Also within 10-15 mins walking distance to some major attractions and streets. I could list them all but the review would be too long. I didn't even need a travel card for most days!

Reviews.Title: “It was brilliant to stay here”
Reviews.Author: clive10_10
Reviews.Content: It was well situated, quiet whilst near toeverything you could wish for i.e. places of interest, underground etc Staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely use this hotel again.”
Reviews.Author: joanne g
Reviews.Content: Very clean, modern hotel with friendly, helpful staff within walking distance of Berlin's many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel staff couldn't be more friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: ruth h
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my daughter for a short sight-seeing trip and it was a very good base for that - close to museums, galleries, bars etc but also to the tube stop. the hotel is very clean and modern with well equipped rooms and a really excellent breakfast. we also used the restaurant which was very good too. every member of staff we dealt with had time to chat and smile and be genuinely friendly and pleasant. i would definitely use the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location great service nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Soosie999
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff and quirky decor - Wall Street is the theme (the rooms have the most amazing US Dollar carpet) made this stay very pleasant and easy. A two minte walk from an Underground station with many attractions within a 20 minute walk. Nice property pretty good value.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel let down by painfully slow bar / evening restuarant service.”
Reviews.Author: GrandmaShropshireUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in August 2011. The hotel itself was very well appointed. Very modern and in a quiet location. The hotel has a secure part of the local underground car park for guests to use, although it did take us some time to find the entrance and the intercom to the hotel wasn't working when we used it. We were assured that the intercom problem would be fixed, but as we left the car there during our stay, never had cause to use it again to see if it had been. It is ideally situated for the underground, about 200 metres walk away and Alexander Platz is only 2 stops away. The Berlin Card is brilliant and can be bought at the hotel reception. It gives you free travel ( U and S trains, trams & buses and discounts from loads of attractions, restuarants etc...)). We had an executive room, which we could not fault. Extremely large bathroom, quality toiletries, comfortable king sized bed, mini fridge, complimentary internet, work desk, tv, and seperate area between bathroom & bedroom, which could be used for dressing, storage & even had table & chair, so we both had work areas for our laptops ! The breakfast was self service, with an excellent selection of foods available. We certainly didn't go hungry. My only criticism was that on the 1st morning I had asked a very pleasant waitress if decaf tea was available and she said yes & actually brought it to me. The single tea bag cover stated " decaffinated tea- infuse for 4 minutes", but on the 2nd morning, that waitress was not there & I asked another member of staff, who said they didn't think they had decaf, but would ask. A Manager type person approached my partner & told him that they didn't have decaf tea - to which my partner said that that was strange as I'd had some yesterday. They did have decaf coffee & I settled for that, but the attidude of staff was not good as we were made to feel as though we'd made the whole thing up. On our 1st evening we ate at the hotel. As we approached the restaurant I said that we had a reservation, but I'd like to go to the bar first for a drink. The waiter said that he could see to our drinks & what would we like ? 23 minutes later we got our beers !!!! The food being served after ordering was just as slow and very small portions by German standard. So the next night we ate out & went to the Kartoffelcabin which was fantastic. Berlin is certainly not short of restuarants and with transport being so easy to use, finding good food is not a problem. I would stay here again, but other than breakfast would go out to eat & drink.

Reviews.Title: “COMFORTABLE ROOMS BUT BUSSINES TYPE OF HOTEL !”
Reviews.Author: Goldendust
Reviews.Content: We had executive room that they are on the 5th floor ...the hotel is in good location ,they have U Just a 2 minute walk away and to the Museum Island it's just a good 15-20 minutes walk or with bicycles just 5 minutes :) It's relaxing with no noise during the sleeping hours and in general I only used the hotel as a resting point bc we were out on the bicycles the whole day! :) The receptionist is always there to help out if we needed some directions but it was always a busy area so it sometimes not possible to wait that long !!! the check in was quite hectic as they had a lot of people in the hotel ,we arrived around 10 and they said the room will be ready around 2 as check in is about that time but when we came back room was not ready till 4:45 .. They offered us free drink at the Bar till our room was ready ..as a apology treat ,This was nice of them to do :) But still it has a kind of cozy feeling the place and the people of the hotel just do their best even thu they are very busy ...:) we did not eat there or had breakfast so i can't really say anything about that !! The sauna in the basement was really relaxing !!!!!!!!!! absolute tranquility i must say!

Reviews.Title: “Pefect!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lucy_dobson
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything you could want - all areas of the hotel are clean, tidy and modern. Room sizes are great and this also was one of few places you can ACTUALLY get a double bed (ie not two single beds pushed together - what's that about?!). Very comfortable at that too. Staff are very friendly and helpful, check in/out flawless. Would recommend to anyone - will stay again :)

Reviews.Title: “Splendid service! I will definitely come back to this hotel! :-)”
Reviews.Author: Nhan T
Reviews.Content: The service at the reception was remarkable! One guy helped me finding a massage studio and one girl helped me book it. I was in contact with the hotel before arrival to reserve a nice room. Which I did get :) But I think it was a little bit irritating with the curtains. It was very see-through, so in the morning, the light was shining at my face. I'm depending on a dark room when I sleep. The bathroom was so nice and big. The shower head was BIG and very good. The best I've seen in a hotel actually! And the room was so quiet! The atmosphere of the hotel was also very nice. Housekeeping was smiling and greeted nicely. And the breakfast was very good. A lot to choose between. The only thing I missed was the menu at the resturant. There was like 5 main courses. Little bit poor menu. We ordered a steak (MEDIUM) and it was almost raw when we cutted it. But I don't really like to complain, so we just ated it :/ But it was good though..hehe! And one tip for the hotel. My boyfriend tried to order a cider for me at the bar. But the guy couldn't really understand what that was. Maybe is bigger in Sweeden. But F.Y.I cider is like a soda with alcohol. More of a girls beer :) I ordered a Long Island Ice Tea and it was sooo strong. I think the Germans likes it that way :P The location of the hotel was good. The girl at the front desk said that it took 2 minutes to the nearest U-bahn. But that was wrong, it took maybe 30 seconds! :D Took only 2 stops to get to Alexander platz. (The U-bahn drives VERY FAST in Germany unlike Oslo where I l live!) Or 15-20 minutes to walk. But I definitely recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, we would definetely go back!”
Reviews.Author: Blongs69
Reviews.Content: Great service from friendly staff throughout our stay, with the staff always helpful and everyone we spoke to had very good English skills. The hotel looks great, especially around the public areas, with a US Wallstreet/dollar theme throughout. The bar was very well stocked (with plenty of rare whiskies) and had a great selection of cocktails which pleased my wife. The hotel is very well situated for the U-Bahn station Märkisches Museum, which is on the U2 line, although we made the mistake of taking the exit marked for the museum at the station when we arrived, which takes you out the wrong side (i.e. further away). Breakfast was buffet style, with a large choice of food on offer. The hot food was boiled and scrambled egg, sausage, meatballs and bacon (there was something else as well I’m sure). The cold choices where very numerous from smoked fish, various cold meats, rolls, bread and of course the essential, UK style white sliced bread and toaster. Overall there was plenty of choice and a ready supply of tea/coffee, 3 types of fruit juice and iced water. Check-in was fast and pleasant, although entry to the room was not until 2pm. However it’s not a problem to leave suitcases and wander about or enjoy the bar. The room was fairly spacious with a good sized bathroom (although it only had a shower in ours, but some rooms do have a bath). The surrounding area was pretty quiet at night, so noise is not an issue with this hotel. Bed was on the firm side, but okay. It was a double with 2 pillows on it and an extra in the cupboard. Only thing I’ve not seen before (maybe this is a German thing) was although it was a double bed you got to single duvets, not really an issue, just a bit strange. Room was well appointed having a safe, hairdryer, coffee machine, mini bar/fridge, TV with pay channel option, fast wireless internet (via free voucher from reception – each voucher lasts 24 hours so get one for each day) and controllable heating/cooling (the cooling action modest in our room). The cream carpet in the room (which features the dollar bill motif) showed signs of age, but I’ve been informed that they are in the process of replacing them. Room overall was of good quality. In conclusion, we would definitely use this hotel again if we come to Berlin again.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anslisa
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay. Staff really polite and helpful speaking very good English. Really impressed by hotel decor; modern, light and spacious. We had an executive room this Was very large and comfortable. The hotel was within walking distance for all tourist sites. We had a fantastic stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fresh and modern-we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: JeraldineAndrew
Reviews.Content: General: Excellent service throughout with genuinely friendly staff. The decor was fresh, modern and minimalist. Rooms: spacious and clean with nice touches: Nespresso coffee machines, chocolates and gum bear treats, hairdryers and iron/ironingboard (I hate battery powered dryers and having to order an iron when travelling!!) Food: Breakfast was excellent, with a huge variety on offer: smoked salmon, meats, breads, fruit, yoghurts, cheeses and cereals. We had a groupon deal so had a very limited and basic menu for dinner one night (currywurst or schnitzel!); nevertheless, it was decent enough. The regular menu looked a lot more extensive however, and the service was fine. Gym: a small but perfectly functional gym (treadmill, steps, crosstrainer and limited weights) is in the basement-good enough for a quick blast- along with a sauna and lounge area (all immaculate). All towels and toiletries were provided and topped up each day. Location: We came on a two night leisure break and it was fine for us to explore the city. We are a fit couple in our 30s, so walking isn't an issue for us (15mins to Alexander Platz); but after a long day exploring we were pleased to relieve our feet and used the U-bahn at night ('Markische Museum' on the red U2 line), which took us to most obvious spots within a few minutes. I would certainly recommend this hotel for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Clean well lit place but service and booking terms leave for much improvement”
Reviews.Author: Jdvmc
Reviews.Content: To our horror we were greeted with a soiled and cider stained extra bed in plain view. They rectified it albeit on unclear terms We were upgraded to a junior suite (we are two parents, one 3 and 12-year old) but got charged for it for 40€ per Night. We hesitantly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable hotel in quiet but very central location. Highly recommened!!”
Reviews.Author: rebs1007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Plaza Wallstreet for three nights and were very impressed. The staff all spoke good English and were very friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and spacious, although possibly not as "themed" as I was hoping based on previous reviews! The beds and bedding were very comfortable and although we had a twin room it was easy to push the beds together. The bathroom was modern and clean with a fantastic shower. Good features of the hotel were the free wifi and that they let us leave our suitcase for the afternoon after check in as our flight was not until late evening. The only negative was that you had to pay for the tv, so we didn't bother. Location was pretty quiet, although there was a nice bar in the next street next to the river. If you do want a more lively atmosphere it's not really a problem as the Markisches Museum UBahn stop is only about 100 metres away so the hotel is really easily accessible by public transport. We had no problems getting around and it's a great location for exploring the city, particularly Museum Island, Alexanderplatz and the surrounding area.

Reviews.Title: “excelent!”
Reviews.Author: tr-wals
Reviews.Content: 100 m to S-bahn station, friendly staff, very clean and nice rooms, breakfast worth every €, we will use same hotel next visit to Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: mt-ky
Reviews.Content: Convenient location to visit most of the tourist sites on foot or by metro. Situated between to 2 metro stations which are about 5 minutes walk. Restaurants and grocery store about 1 block away from Museum Metro stop (walking towards Museum Island). Clean, modern and bright rooms with very comfortable firm bed. Also included 3 desirable features: free in room WIFI, large in room safe and kettle/coffee maker. Hotel breakfast seemed awfully expensive so we ate out. The grocery store had a nice bakery with pastries, sandwiches and coffee. There was also a little cafe next door to the grocery store as well which offered reasonably priced breakfast as well.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin meets America and the best of both worlds”
Reviews.Author: sean-tKerryIreland
Reviews.Content: A themed hotel this form the stock exchange type figures on the carpets to symbols of the might ydollar and happy investors on the wallpaper it's Berlin with a smile and a wonderfully rexaled yet efficent approach to customer service and business here. Reception are very good and friendly , I particularly remember a young lady with long straight dark hair who was more than pleasant and helpful.Can't remember her name. Rooms are very comfortable and the leisure side consists of a sauna and gym. Good location right next to the underground and close to restaurants yet in a quiet street so a restful night will be gauranteed. Also pricewise one can't argue it's very good value I would give the hotel four and a half stars but Tripadvisor won't let me.A swimming pool , even a small one would have clinched five stars. A very well run hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to public transport”
Reviews.Author: zmarting
Reviews.Content: This is a cozy hotel, close to the U-bahn, which is nice, since there isn't much to see close to the hotel. The service and breakfast was good, but it the walk to our room felt a bit like a labyrinth. The hotel also has a nice backyard, which we ufortunately wasn't able to use because it was raining during our stay. Also free wi-fi, but the system with the vouchers isn't the best

Reviews.Title: “Great value, rooms smallish”
Reviews.Author: ruudvw
Reviews.Content: Pretty good hotel with an very good location in Berlin Mitte: 5-10 minutes by foot to Unter den Linden and the Alexanderplatz. U-bahn station is 1 minute walking. Rooms are small, but decently equipped. Especially the bathroom is nice and modern, the beds are a bit hard for my linking though. Minibar and bar downstairs are a bit expensive, but the overall value is great at approximately 60 euro/night when staying > 1 night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice place, good staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Ramona26
Reviews.Content: We had booked several rooms for a family reunion. We had some problems with beds (as is often the case, we had booked twin rooms and got a couple of doubles instead). When we complained, we got a free upgrade for one of the rooms, to an executive which was as nice as the suite. The hotel was nearly full but it did not feel that way, the staff were patient and keen to please... We had thought we would skip the breakfast because it seemed so expensive, but after a few of us tried, decided we loved it and happily joined in. The location is perfect, close to all the main attractions yet in an incredibly quiet street. Funky decor, good rooms, we were very happy with our choice in spite of the initial problems!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fine. Would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: diesied
Reviews.Content: This appears to be a fairly new hotel in the centre of Berlin. It seems to have been converted from a series of other buildings and this leads to long meandering corridors and a general disorientation. On the plus side you get big windows that all open wide! My room was clean and smart with a decent sized bathroom much bigger than your standard business hotel. The bed was comfortable and there was a good sized desk for working. The staff were friendly and polite throughout. No problems, no stress, just as it should be.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, modern and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: gregbrandtner
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Berlin for 3 days and were as impressed with the hotel as the rest of the city. The location is ideal as its very close to most central things and a short walk to a good underground train link. Also walking distance from the Nicolai district which is fantastic for dinners at night, one great restaurant next to the other. Its also a very short walk from the Jannovic bridge which has a great little beach bar and a station for some Spree-river boats, also highly recommended. The hotel is very modern, clean, comfortable - very friendly staff as well. Rooms are quite large, we were very pleasantly surprised. The beds were VERY comfortable, maybe too comfortable because we actually ended up sleeping until 11am every morning. No room noise at all. Great bar downstairs. Honestly for the price the hotel can't be faulted - we won't have to look elsewhere next time we come to Berlin. I'd recommend it for leisure and business actually, will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great city hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BROCKWELL
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a standard room which was better than a lot of superior rooms we have stayed in. First floor room overlooking the main street we had no noise problems over the 5 day stay. We did not try the breakfasts but eventually found a cafe bar which did all you can eat buffet breakfast for under 6€. the name escapes me but only a 10 min walk , it's on Lindenstr (opposite is a giant man stood on one leg on a wall!) Was in a group of 6, a minibus from Schonefeld airport was under 40€ total.

Reviews.Title: “Second time round is big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: bean_ari
Reviews.Content: After being so happy with my previous stay here, I decided to book again. I had to add 2 nights stay to my booking, and this meant my original good rate for 2 nights already was increased, and the additional two nights were twice the rate of the already booked nights as well... Then my room that already costs SOOOO much more than my first stay here is a cryptic sequence of doors and hallways away from the lift. Then it is half the size of last time, a single bed instead of double for last time, and a view of a courtyard of other peoples' windows, instead of a lovely city view last time. DISAPPOINTMENT. And now I'll be charged if I wish for a cutlery set to be brought to my room. I am so disappointed in my second stay here. Same room title, completely different quality.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Lyreco55
Reviews.Content: The reception staff were very friendly and helpful at all times, the room was very clean and nice I really did enjoy my stay here :)

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel with nice locition”
Reviews.Author: alqu00
Reviews.Content: Clean, quite and in good location... I will stay thier on my next visit

Reviews.Title: “pleased”
Reviews.Author: Erhan08
Reviews.Content: All the staff was very kind and helpful. The hotel is located pretty close to the centrum of Berlin, it is very close to two metro/subway stations. The room has a nice desgin and it is very clean to, it has cleaning every day.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel! best value for money in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: sharon_love_2_travel
Reviews.Content: How I wish there were other hotels like this one in other major European cities! It is such a good hotel you just can't miss! The room gives you sexy feeling - it is well designed, with fresh modern style. The cost is really reasonable (we paid around 100EUR for double without breakfast). Next to the hotel (on your way to the tube) there is a nice small coffee shop with reasonable price, excellent breakfast menu. Just remember on your way out of the tube to take the right staircase and than the hotel is on your opposite left. Great bargin, 15 min walk from alexander platz and about 30 min walk to Sony (or 10 min drive by train) . Kreuzberg is 30 min walk (you have to go the liquidrom!!!). I am sure this will be my hotel on my next visit to Berlin...

Reviews.Title: “Modern well maintained hotel in a good position for tourists but with limited facilities.”
Reviews.Author: SimonandDenise
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to two metro stations and within easy walking distance of Museum Island and other tourist sites. The hotel is modern and clean and the bedrooms well furnished. The restaurant menu was limited and quite expensive but at dinner the food was excellent. The breakfast was expensive and not up to the standard of the rest of the hotel. The fitness room was very small.

Reviews.Title: “Different... but nice”
Reviews.Author: Pipsqueak78
Reviews.Content: The Decor is what makes this place so different as there is a money theme to it... including on the carpets! They left tissues in the room that had the appearance of money and they even went as far as to scatter chocolate coins on the bed. Quite amusing really, certainly never seen this anywhere else before. The hotel itself is in a quiet location, so quiet that I don't even recall seeing another living soul on the street, it's fairly central and not too far from the underground so you can get around to all the major sites easily. The room was of average size but the bed made it feel as though I was in heaven... most comfortable bed I have ever had the pleasure of sleeping in! Nothing stands out to say this is an amazing place to stay, but i would stay here again and I would recommend it to others; possibly more for business though... quirkly decor aside

Reviews.Title: “A great place from which to explore Berlin. Friendly helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: NicolePeppiatt
Reviews.Content: A great location from which to explore Berlin. Located within 50metres of two U-bahn stations and walking distance from most of the sights. Very helpful and friendly staff from the moment we walked through the doors. Comfortable clean rooms. A lovely bar to relax in after exploring the city. A great place for busines or pleasure to stay in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “A travel agents honest review! Fantastic Hotel, facilities, staff etc.”
Reviews.Author: travelagentdean
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property on the 4th March for a 2 night duration. On arrival the staff greeted us with great service and dealt with our party of 11 in no time. I was amazed with the decor of the hotel. Its styled in the theme of a wall street banking and stock exchange this (as you can see from the pictures!) In the room was twin beds, flat screen tv, and a free safe. Bathroom consisted of a free standing sink and shower etc. Beds were changed everyday. I went into my friends rooms and they were of the same standard. The bar area has the widest range of spirits i have ever seen in my life! Obviously the hotel wasnt the cheapest place to have a drink but it was really nice before heading out. A pint of beer was 5 euro in the hotel. The hotel was situated near and underground station which was a only about 200 yards away. Overall i would recommend this hotel to any of my clients wishing to stay in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway for young couple”
Reviews.Author: LeighPhils
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms are clean and spacious with high ceilings. Sliding bathroom door that didnt close perfectly that left around an inch gap. But this coincides with the hotels funky designed rooms. Hotel very good location, around 100m from Markisches Museum U-Bahn stop and only 2 stops to Alexanderplatz. Hotel bar had great selection and was priced equivalently to Berlin bars. Very enjoyable stay, would recommend and stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Place to stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: battlefieldhistorian
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in central Berlin, in between two U Bahn stations, so it is very easy to get to and access public transport from. You can also easily walk to some of the key sites; it only took 10 minutes to walk across to the Gendarmenmarkt for example. The front of the hotel has character and the main structure of the building is old, but inside it is a very modern hotel. There is a great, open-spaced and welcoming bar. We tried the restaurant on our first night having had a long day and found the food good, and affordable. The staff in both bar and restaurant were very helpful and pleasant. The rooms are decorated in a modern style, and our room for three was spacious with a huge bathroom. We had purchased one of the hotels special packages which included breakfast, plus a welcome bottle of wine and fruit/chocolates for my daughter. We felt the whole deal was very good value for money. Breakfast is in a large downstairs room and was a massive buffet, with so much choice it was hard to know where to start. The scrambled egg was really egg, not powder, which is getting rare in hotels these days. The staff made sure we had plenty of coffee, and we on average took nearly an hour for breakfast each day; no-one hurried us to leave. We had a very pleasant stay here, and an enjoyable four days in Berlin. I am sure this is the first of many visits to this hotel which is one of the best I have stayed in for a long time, and I stay in a lot of hotels! I can particularly recommend it for families and those wanting a quiet place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “B-side Hotel: out of line with the prices”
Reviews.Author: wwwanca_no
Reviews.Content: Do you want to find a very 90' hotel? Do you like big stains on the carpeted floor? Or maybe do you like to see a place that attracts the very old (-economy) business men in escort company? Well go by the bar of this hotel, the defilé starting from 9 pm! Maybe also these "four-stars" falling accidentally from the sky! Room service: bare minimum.

Reviews.Title: “Funny, but good.”
Reviews.Author: bean_ari
Reviews.Content: The decoration/theme is quite odd, but it is done well. I really liked this hotel. The room was very spacious and clean, bright, comfortable. Internet is free. The fitness equipment is quite good. There is a sauna. I had room service and it was very expensive and quite tasteless. The staff very very helpful. The location is conveniently near the U-bahn, but not around very many shops- not too far from things though.

Reviews.Title: “A reasonable choice”
Reviews.Author: Juergen1960
Reviews.Content: The "Wallstreet" is a play on words - the hotel being located on "Wallstrasse" - but the scheme is carried through in the design of the interior: "money coming from heaven" greets you in the reception area, ticker symbols as floor design and - at least in my room - a gigantic US Dollar bill as a carpet etc. Otherwise, the hotel features modern, stylish design throughout. As "Wallstreet" is fitted into an older exterior, hallways come with many corners, etc., taking some edge of the "coolness" The "Fitness room" was a windowless basement affair with 3-4 devices and 2 flatscreens - better to engage in a sightseeing jog to and along Unter den Linden, Brandenburg Gate, Reichstag and back (ca. 7K). My room was smallish, but very quit (facing the back), functional and clean. It was equipped with an excellent double bed, enough wall plugs for all your gadgets, a very strong shower (walk in, no bath), a flat LCD TV, safe, coffee maker, and internet access. The "free" internet option may be sufficient for the casual surfer but "high speed" access and a VPN tunnel needed by business travellers require the common overpriced purchase option. The midsized breakfast room is friendly and functional and the buffet ok. The young staff was fast and very friendly throughout my stay. The "Wallstreet" is covieniently located in the eastern heart of the city, within walking distance (10-15 Minutes along a canal) to major attractions including Alexanderplatz, Berlin Dom, Museuminsel (Pergamon) and strolling further along "Unter den Linden" to Reichstag, Brandenburg Gate, and Friedrichstrasse. Also, the posh Gendarmenmarkt-area is within a 15-20 Min walk. If you prefer public transit: 2 subway stations are within a few hundred meters. The hotel features a small restaurannt area (Didn't use it) and a bar in the lobby that was pretty much deserted duting my stay. Also, in the direct neighborhood there aren't many hip restaurants, bars, or night clubs; you will need to walk about 15-20 Min to reach areas such as Gendarmenmarkt or Hackesche Höfe/Scheunenviertel

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: MarcelNLD
Reviews.Content: Fantastic, The Art'otel by Park Plaza WallStreet is a relatively new, stylish and trendy place. The room was relatively large, bright and offers a nice view (like my room 523). The staff is very friendly and their kindness is natural. The wireless internet is free of charge and works very well. The Art'otel Wall-Street by Park Plaza is a great place to stay, especially for couples who want to try out something new. We had a greate time during ower stay!

Reviews.Title: “Decent but could be much better”
Reviews.Author: Janesse
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great if you are planning on using the subway to get around Berlin as it's right down the street from a stop. Just make sure you exit out of the right set of stairs.... For the hotel itself I was rather disappointed after reading some of the glowing reviews and seeing pictures. The rooms look MUCH better in photos than in person. We found them rather tacky and cheap looking which can be easily overlooked. My biggest complaint however is that it was filthy! I had to wipe down the counters in the bathroom because there was hair and soap residue on them. The floor was really disgusting with hair everywhere and stains like someone kept their shoes in there. We asked the front desk if they could mop it quickly the next morning but it was never done in the 3 days we were there. I think they just swept it once. There is so much dust and grime built up that it was really disgusting. It's like they never dusted, even though there are ledges right beside the bed. Sleep quality was poor for myself and my husband. We don't really like hard beds and these were like sleeping on the floor. The good thing was that you don't get any street noise as the hotel is located in a very quiet area. Oh and there is free internet you just need to ask the front desk for some vouchers to get the username and password for 24 hrs. There isn't however free breakfast which was rather disappointing as this was the only hotel we stayed in that didn't provide that. You'll have to go to Alexanderplatz or somewhere else to find some restaurants as there didn't seem to be anything close to the hotel. For a hotel that was recently renovated I expected the rooms to be in better shape. Overall it wasn't a bad price for what you got but I'm sure there are much better hotels out there.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Pierre4823
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights, including New Year's Eve, in two Junior Suites. Staff friendly and efficient. I agree with previous reviewers that it is at first difficult to locate your room but the rooms were comfortable with good bathrooms and free wi fi. We ate at the hotel restaurant on one occasion and the food was well prepared. The bar at the front of the hotel is a good meeting place. The friendly staff opened up the business centre on the top floor for us shortly before midnight on NYE and we enjoyed a great view of the fireworks from all around Berlin. We have stayed at only two hotels in Berlin and while the Park Plaza was very different to the Sofitel, I would have no hesitation about recommending this as a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hopitable staff, relaxing bar and very comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: Gootevos
Reviews.Content: During the december holidays of 2010, we went on a ten-day trip to Berlin and stayed at the Wallstreet Park Plaza. Overall, our long stay was extremely comfortable, we would definitely recommend it to our closest friends, with only a few minor points of critique. The check-in was quick and effortless. We had made an online booking for the executive suite. We were placed on the fifth floor. Minor critique: no help with luggage. Tip: use the whole name of the hotel if you get a cab. They only know the Wallstreet Park Plaza. Furthermore, there seemed to be a difference between the offer we booked online (Booking.com) and the service the hotel was able to deliver. Nothing big: just no fruits or free bottle of wine, or a free movie every night. The promoted cinema in the hotel was closed most of the time. The staff at the reception was exceptionally friendly, informative and helpfull, be it on Xmas eve, new years day or late at night. Even a simple call downstairs for a new (free!) access code to the hotel wifi internet was treated with hospitality. In addition, we were very impressed by the quality of the food from the bar menu and the available wines, and by the warmth and friendliness of the staff behind the bar. We specifically enjoyed the Riesling and the Montepulciano. Not cheap, but good value for money. Great non-alcoholic cocktails too, by the way. After a few days, the hotel bar became our favourite place to unwind and digest the day. The executive room was very comfortable, with modern design, and especially the bathroom was very spatious. The room had a creative twist: the money/Wallstreet-theme was in the carpet, tissues and more. Regrettably, we did not have a very impressive view, despite of being on the top floor. This was, according to one of the receptionists upon checking in, true for the entire hotel. Lastly, the location. The 'WPP' is only a minute away from the Ubahn nr. 2, Märkisches Museum, and within walking distance of the old city sites, such as the Nikolaiviertel. This ubahn, by the way, is a central line that will bring you directly to, among others, Prenzlauerberg, Friendrichshain, and Olympia Stadion or Potsdamer Platz, thus connecting east and west-Berlin. Go here if you're looking for a modernly designed quality hotel with good rates and a hospitable staff in a quiet, but central part of town. Don't go here if you want your hotel to be in the center of Berlin's nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, good value, friendly and helpful staff, pity about the internet”
Reviews.Author: MuseumJunkie99
Reviews.Content: The location of Park Plaza Wallstreet, 2 minutes' walk from the U-Bahn, couldn't be better for museum-crawl and sightseeing. A bus nearby also takes you direct to the main train station. I felt welcomed as soon as I arrived. Every member of the staff I encountered was friendly and approachable. And Ramona at the front desk was especially helpful with all my queries. Housekeeping is prompt and efficient. Overall, the hotel is excellent value for the quality of service, cleanliness, design concept and room, although breakfast at 17 euros is a tad over-priced. And yes, better signage both at the U-Bahn station and the hotel corridor would help (the corridor leading to my room was "hidden" by a door with no signage at all and I had to enlist the help of a hotel staff to track down the location of my room), but this is only a very minor inconvenience. The only real complaint I have would be the internet using the in-room television. I had to request a new keyboard twice because: 1. the first one didn't work at all and 2. each time I typed the letter "N", the letter "K" would appear on the second keyboard. And I had to request not to be billed for internet usage until I eventually got a keyboard that worked. Navigation using the keyboard is a pain, with the mouse replaced by 3 buttons on the keyboard. It works, but it's probably better to bring your own laptop if you need to check your emails or make trip plans.

Reviews.Title: “Scott of Antarctic”
Reviews.Author: Saggart
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Plaza for three nights in December going to the street market Gendarmenmarkt (Fantastic) as we have done previously. The hotel was close to a U2 station which was great unfortunately we came up the wrong steps (Two entrances, poor signage, no mention of Park Plaza hotel) on arrival at Wall street and we wondered in the snow for about ten minutes it was like Scott in the Antarctic but we had no ski shoes!. Once we parked our sleigh and fed the huskies (Joke) we did not feed the huskies. Reception was bright but not inviting and lacked character, but thats due to the general hotel design modern with a stock exchange theme . Good check in reservation quickly sourced reservation we were sent on our way, no porter. Room was a good size no extras as paid for i.e. bottle of wine for upgrade. Toilet seat was dirty (did not complain at this stage) when lifted which was disgusting, They did not clean our room one day said we must have had a DND sign out, we did not!. The guest opinion disregarded they offered to clean our room but we declined as we were tired they give us towels and bathroom acessiories. On check out on Thursday 16th Dec, as we had prepaid, we requested a receipt and informed them off our problems during stay. The printer was broken so no receipt (It is to follow) as it took up to ten minutes we had a taxi waiting and he had clocked up 7 euro before we took off. Altogether an average stay good rooms, themed hotel, with impersonal touch

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for Christmas Markets”
Reviews.Author: cb161
