Reviews.Content: This hotel is on a quiet street mid-way between two underground stations. It is no more than two stops away from two of the main markets, Gerdarmenmarkt and Alexanderplatz. Both are within walking distance also, if you're wrapped up well. The hotel itself is pristine. Rooms are sleek, warm, modern. Reception and bar staff were very friendly. Room rate was reasonable and wireless internet access was available free (using a voucher). Would strongly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very sympatic Staff.”
Reviews.Author: JoeNidrum
Reviews.Content: In this hotel you feel that you're welcome. Well located, nice and with modern look you will find there whatever you need to spend a few nice days in Berlin. Breakfirst is fantastic and the bar complete.

Reviews.Title: “Hot summer has revealed big problems”
Reviews.Author: AroundGlobe
Reviews.Content: Overall it's a good business hotel with comfortable rooms and meeting facilities. The staff is friendly and professional, the location is not very central, but nonetheless the hotel is rather close to the main attractions. However the hotel has one big problem which, I reckon, wasn't even anticipated by the management. It is bad A/C which completely went down during extremely hot Berlin summer. We literally couldn't sleep in our rooms and hold conference in a conference hall - it seemed that it was more hot inside that on the streets.

Reviews.Title: “One of the finest hotels in which we have stayed!!”
Reviews.Author: Micame
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have visited 20 European cities in the past two years and the Park Plaza Wallstreet was one of the best. The rooms are well decorated, wonderfully laid out and provided a welcome respite at the end of a long day. The location is quiet and safe, yet only one block from a U-Bahn stop on the U-2. The price was more than reasonable and we found the staff eager to help with any request.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - but not good value”
Reviews.Author: DWM64
Reviews.Content: My fault, because we choose a time when there no price reductions, and compared to other hotels we've stayed in, not good value. This is a business hotel.The rooms were clean and comfortable, but small. The breakfast would have been good value at £5 or £6 but not at 26euro. No complaints about the quality, just the cost. The staff were helpful, polite and friendly, and did everything to make us welcome. There were small things which irriated - 5euro to access internet, only decaff coffee and powdered milk for example. Location is OK in what was the old East, but a little bit out of the way for walking out in the evening. Access to Ubahn very easy for sight seeing etc. There are some pleasant bars & restaurants locally (but don't be tempted by Motte Hoppe - guide book said service offhand, but it was actually plain rude). If I'd paid 150 euro for b&b we'd have been recommending this hotel, so if you can that price or better, then fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: thanos_n
Reviews.Content: Only positives I can find for that hotel. First it’s location in Mitte area from where you can visit on foot the museum island and all the sightseeing at Alexanderplatz. The underground station was too close a 5 minute distance but even more comfort was that the line 2 of the underground was working through the night so it is possible to have a night stroll using the public means of transport. The room was quite spacious and very clean. We didn’t book for breakfast but the offered us a better price when we arrived there so we accepted it. The buffet was great with plenty variety of food. All the members of the hotel staff were very helpful. The departure day we had the ability to leave our things on the hotel in order to have a last shopping walk to the city without the problem having with us our baggage. The only negative was the slow wifi internet which of course it was free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Arty, Trendy & close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Intelins
Reviews.Content: The Art'otel by Park Plaza Wall-Street is a relatively new, stylish and trendy place. Every room is unique and decorated by another artist. The rooms are relatively big, bright and some offer a nice view (like my room 521) on Alexander Square and the TV Tower. The staff is very friendly and their kindness seems natural. The wireless internet is free of charge and works very well. The Art'otel Wall-Street by Park Plaza is a great place to stay, especially for couples who want to try out something new.

Reviews.Title: “Not for those who value their privacy!”
Reviews.Author: Ottomania
Reviews.Content: A well-located bright boutique-style hotel with great breakfast room – but it's a shame no-one kept a tighter check on the design team. The ensuite bathroom doors are not only only semi-opaque, but don't actually close, let alone lock. Many people seemed not to relish performing intimate functions in full view of their partner/co-traveller and had retreated to the loos adjacent to the bar area. Service is a tad surly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and well located hotel. The staff is...”
Reviews.Author: Riedim
Reviews.Content: Nice and well located hotel. The staff is very friendly, helpful and highly motivated. Clean rooms. I can absolutely recommend this spot and I would choose the hotel again for a stay in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: NWPDWR
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and were really pleased with our choice. The hotel building was lovely, the bar and restaurant were modern and there was even a private cinema! The room was really modern/minimalist and the walls of the en-suite were all glass (but not see-through!). It was only a two minute walk to the metro station, and you could walk to Alexander Platz in 10 minutes. The hotel is on a really quite street, which allowed for the best sleep ever! Would absolutely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: kkimColorado
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here with a family of 5 (in 2 rooms) and both rooms were very nice!! The entire hotel is very clean with very modern furniture and fixtures. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The only negative was because of the heat the air conditioner system was not working properly and it was very hot. I did complain to the manager who offered us a few things to make up for it. Great breakfast too!!Would go back in a minute!!

Reviews.Title: “quiet, great bed and close to the underground.”
Reviews.Author: kantarell
Reviews.Content: Very nice, quiet rooms with great beds. The hotel was one minute from the undergroundstation and made it easy to go everywhere. Not much privacy in the bathroom due to glassdoor with "open" handel. The hotelstaff did change the towels everey day even if we did not put them at the floor as the sign said (to save the environment).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: anneju15
Reviews.Content: Hotel was recommended by friends who had stayed before. We were not disappointed. Nicely decorated room with good facilities and comfy bed. Air conditioning had a job to cool room but it was exceptionally hot weather. Staff friendly and helpful. Situated in a quiet area near the river but central enough to walk most places. Very close to underground station. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: mikeisen21
Reviews.Content: Just surprised my fiance with a Berlin weekend getaway, and this hotel was a perfect. The location was very central, we could walk almost everywhere, but it was also on a quiet street so no noises from street. Also right near two subway stops The room was really big and bed was really comfy. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service at it's very, very best”
Reviews.Author: ukholidaymarket
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Berlin for the first time on business and chose to stay at the Park Plaza after hours of searching the internet. I was not disappointed ! From the first contact with reception on checking in, the friendliness and genuine kindness from the staff has left me speechless. From the bar staff to room service and reception , everyone I came in touch with exceeded my expectations. I run a customer service and sales training business and will be using this hotel as a shining example of how it should be done. As well as the service, the rooms were great . High ceilings , huge windows and lot's of white . Big walk in shower and comfortable beds. I would like to publicly thank Tina, David and Chris for making my stay very special - You are all shining lights - I will be back - Dave Pope , Molotov Business Solutions

Reviews.Title: “Nice atmosfere”
Reviews.Author: EMZNetherlands
Reviews.Content: We were in this hotel 4 years ago and were very pleased with everything. It's near the U-bahn in a quit street. No noice from neighbours and clean design rooms. Breakfast is good and plenty to choose from in a nice light room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service and great rooms”
Reviews.Author: Tue1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very cool inside, and the staff where amazing. I picked up the wrong case at the airport and the lady on reception called the airline and tracked down the other passenger at the opposite side of Berlin for me! Excellent service, huge rooms with cool bars, restaurants etc near by if you make sure you do your research first. Nice facilities inside, couldn't fault anything about it in such a superb city!!

Reviews.Title: “Good enough, could be cheaper”
Reviews.Author: IltellYouWhenIfindIt
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. It was a business travel, so I do not expect much ten fast and nice service and good sleep. More then less this is what I got in this hotel. Breakfast was fine. Conference rooms are fine. If this location suits you, I can recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & Clean”
Reviews.Author: AAAUs
Reviews.Content: We are family of four and stayed at Park Plaza for four days. We loved how modern and clean the hotel is, the beds were comfortable beyond words, the rooms were ample size compared to other european hotels. The location is a little far from the shopping area but it is on a very quiet street and we can walk to several restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: splumpf
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights. Bit more of an expensive hotel that I would normally go for, but it was very nice. Fantastic and original decor, huge bathroom, comfortable beds. Avoid the coffee machine in the room though, the coffee was gross! Breakfast was expensive if it's not already included in the price of the room. There in an underground station about 1 minute walk from the door which is very convenient. Really easy to get to/from tegel airport by public transport. The hotel bar was very nice, with a wide offering of spirits and cocktails. staff very friendly and all speak excellent english. Hotel location is excellent - well placed next to the underground stop but also within walking distance of the main attractions if you don't want to take the train (although I recommend you do - it is really easy to use, clean and cheap)

Reviews.Title: “Modern and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaulinaT
Reviews.Content: Wallstreet Plaza is a very nice and tidy hotel. The location is pretty good (10 min walking to get to Museum island) and the metro is just at the corner. Our room was modern and funny. As the main theme of the hotel is wall street, there was a one dollar bill printed on the rug. The size of the room and the bed were neat. The only negative thing is that breakfast was not included and it costs 12.5 per person.

Reviews.Title: “Truly friendly service, rooms a little eclectic”
Reviews.Author: 100nights
Reviews.Content: This is a relatively new hotel, the staff were sincerely friendly and of course efficient ( as you would expect in Germany). The rooms and public areas are designed around the WallStreet stock market theme, which is cute, but at times distracted from the functionality of the room. The wavy desk (money?), means that your stuff slides all over the place. Housekeeping was somewhat erratic ~ several things missed each day. Wireless is free, but poor. They need more bandwidth and repeaters around the hotel. Nevertheles, on balance a good value stay (because the service is so genuine)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sonyapr1119
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, a true 4 star hotel, great location is you like to walk, great service and the people are extremely helpful. The staff at the bar made us feel very special and the front desk could not be more friendly. The rooms are just like the picture and if you become a member you can get an upgrade. I would recomment this hotel hightly. Orlando, Florida

Reviews.Title: “Small, Clean Room; Good Value”
Reviews.Author: VirtuallyAnywhere
Reviews.Content: The room was small, but clean and very well arranged. The bed was a bit too firm, but in good shape. In general, the hotel seemed well cared for. Free wireless internet on top of what was already a very nice price added to the value. Breakfast (not included) was also nice, and not as expensive as other hotels in Berlin-mitte. Good location in an area renovated after the wall came down and only 100 yards to an U-Bahn station. I expect I will be back. The desk staff were as friendly and helpful as any I have seen. Given that there is a decidedly American theme throughout ("Wallstreet"?), I expect they spoke English well. I actually liked the fact, though, that they did not immediately switch to English but allowed me to set the tone by speaking German.

Reviews.Title: “Simply perfect”
Reviews.Author: SylvieRemscheid
Reviews.Content: Super location, great service. Staff was extremely friendly and the bar and cocktails were great. We will certainly come again. Berlin is a great city and not so expensive as Paris or London. The rooms were very comfortable and very quiet. Underground just two minutes walk and the city center within walking distance. The breakfast was great too, even though a bit crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: outrun78
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel before when it had just opened and the good news is that 3 years down the line it is still as impressive as ever. Was allocated room 526 which is not the largest room in the hotel to be honest and last time i stayed in an executive room but it benefited from a balcony which was just under the penthouse so a nice view of the ever changing Berlin skyline. Hotel still hardly looks worn, especially considering the dollar bill print cream coloured carpet. Super comfortable beds, good pillows. Only niggle in the room i would say is the lack of an iron and ironing board in the room but loads of storage space and in room safe and honesty mini bar. As i spent most of the stay enjoying the nightlife, it meant sleeping in most days really late, not a peep from the corridors or the adjoining roms. Be warned though that the maid service does end a little early so you may awake at 3pm to find some fresh towels, toilet roll and toiletries for the bathroom in a bag hung on the door handle which i guess is better than them not servicing the room at all. Managed to try the sauna/fitness room this time round, quiet and relaxing which is how this should be. Bar food was okay and bar prices for drinks are reasonable compared to the UK for a starter on a night out. Fantastic welcoming service throughout the whole of my stay I honestly did not want to leave and one of my favourite hotels in Berlin. Would recommend this in an instant to anyone looking for a special stay in a modern fresh looking hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, excellent Staff, Christmastime too :)”
Reviews.Author: Alan-Abroad
Reviews.Content: This was our firsrt experience in Berlin. The staff ´were really great, friendly and very professional. We have a Gluten Free food allergy, but this was no problem for them. They even checked with the head chef to see if the menu could be modified to suit our needs. I would highly recomend this Hotel to anyone that would love to visit Berlin. We had a great time there, and wish we could go back soon

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mark8624
Reviews.Content: My partner and our parents stayed at this hotel over the Christmas Market weeks and I have not got one negative point to make on the stay. The Hotel is extremely comfortable, clean and with excellent facilities. The staff overall were totally professional in all services they provided and I would not consider another hotel when I return to Berlin, which was also just as impressive. We also found the location to be private and quiet, which was a great positive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: MCT672
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at Park Plaza Wallstreet. I usually check reviews here when staying at a new hotel but did not have time as these reservations were made for me last minute. I was pleasantly surprised. This is a nice boutique hotel. More than that it also seems to have really thought through the design. My room had a cute dollar bill rug. Two modern desk chairs. Lot's of storage in the well thought out design. There is a typical wardrobe(although no iron/ironing board that I could find) but also has plenty of storage on the sides of the bed (two cabunets with mini bar and coffee station). The cabinets extended over the bed as well making a nice cozy sleeping area. I thought the room was very spacious compared to other European hotels I have stayed at (Room 302). The bathroom was just a glass walled section of the room - not terribly private but fine if you are alone. I did not have the water issue mentioned below but they may have taken care of that as there was a plastic lip on the bottom of the shower door to prevent leakage into the rest of the bathroom. The bathrrom was not spacious (would be hard for two to share) but well appointed. Best hotel hair dryer I ever used. The beds were twins pushed together with two twin duvets. I should have called and asked for a queen duvet, but did not think it would be an issue. Sleep ing on the twins together was fine as I only take one side usually but the twin duvet was way too small. The room was quiet but you could hear foot falls as people walked down the hall - not a big deal - I usually sleep well. My only disappointment was the slow service at breakfast. After sitting down it took over 10 minutes (and I had to ask) for some one to bring me coffee. The staff seemed very distracted. The rest of the service was fine. Front desk was great as was room service (but a limited menu). I would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aberdeenjohn
Reviews.Content: Good room (225), very quiet indeed. Good food (dinner). Excellent breakfast. The staff could not have been more pleasant and helpful. 50 yds from U2 - so 10mins from Potsdamer Plz and Alexander Plz, what more could you ask!

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the Business Traveller”
Reviews.Author: brodieDublin
Reviews.Content: Positives: Friendly reception staff, clean rooms, leisure facilities (sauna), good location (near train station). Negatives: Expensive breakfast, very atmosphere less hotel, really bad layout of rooms. Cute carpets in the bedroom with the dollar bill on them!!!! We paid quite and expensive rate for this hotel - it was the weekend of the Berlin Marathon - felt it should have included breakfast for what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mrsautzen
Reviews.Content: We recently enjoyed some very nice days at the Park Plaza Wallstreet Berlin. From the beginning to the end our stay very comfortable. Hotel was very nice, stay very friendly and very serviceminded. It was our impression that they all worked very well together as a team. Room was nice, no problems with the shower :-) like others mention, everyday the room was cleaned very well. Breakfast was not cheap ! yes LIDL rigtht around the corner BUT breakfast was wonderful didn´t miss a thing there. The atmosphere in the bar at night was really nice and the prices there were reasonable. The location was okey VERY close to the U bahn. We were very happy with Park Plaza Wallstreet Berlin and their wonderful staff, we had a very nice time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but terrible service”
Reviews.Author: politikgirl
Reviews.Content: The Park Plaza Wallstreet is a beautiful hotel with modern and trendy-looking rooms that are great to look at but subsantially less great to use. The shower, in particular, was on the same level as the bathroom floor and subsequently, water would flow from the shower onto the bathroom floor. The location is good, as it is only 2 steps away from a U-Bahn stop. The area itself is very quiet and boring during the day and at night, but given its proximity to a U-Bahn stop, this doesn't matter so much. The service, on the other hand, was absolutely terrible. The staff were cold, unfriendly and downright unhelpful. When someone called to look for us, they were told that we were not guests of the hotel even though they had our names in their system. When I called to ask for an extra pillow upon arriving at the hotel past midnight, the receptionist actually said "now?" in a disgruntled tone and then proceeded to not bring the pillow up at all. If you don't care about service, you may consider staying at this hotel (only if you don't mind a really wet and slippery bathroom floor) but if service is remotely of interest to you, stay far away from the Park Plaza Wallstreet!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but needs improvments”
Reviews.Author: woldtravel
Reviews.Content: We also found this hotel through tripadvisor, so from reading other reviews, we have decided to book this one. However, it was not all to expectations. My husband and I stayed there for 4 days. The good part is that the room is clean and has cool decors and it also has coffee tea maker in the room which is nice. The location is good, it's only 100 meters away from the U bahn station and it's also quiet. There is a supermarket and a bakery at the other side of the hotel. The breakfast is way too expensive 17 euro, the bakery is very nice fresh made bread pastries and sandwiches... only for a euro or 2. You can also get big bottles of water and soda from the supermarket for a fraction of the price that the hotel charges. The negative part of the hotel is the service. One day nobody even made our room even when we had sign on the door to clean the room. We requested the room to be cleaned in the late afternoon when we returned back to the hotel, but the reception said the clean crew only works from 1-3pm which was a lie. We didn't know of course until the very last day that another reception girl said if the clean crew has left, the reception girl would have to clean the room herself and that's part of her job. Apparently the girl was too lazy. We were out of bath gel and shampoo for 2 days and nobody came to refill them. Also they had a false fire alarm set off in the middle of the night around 12am. It was so blasting loud and woke me and my husband up. The announcement said that everyone should get out, so we did go out, but after we got down, nobody from the hotel was downstairs to give any direction or explanation. We had to wait down there for quite some time then the fire truck came to turn off the false alarm. We found it to be very unprofessional and rude of the hotel not to inform the guests what's going on and how long we had to stay out etc which they could do as they had loud speakers earlier to tell people to go downstairs, and afterwords no apologies of any kind for situation like this. In addition, the reception girl gave us the wrong information when we asked how to go to the museum island. She directed us on the wrong bus that actually went a different direction, and it took us more than an hour to get there instead of 10 minutes or so. Free internet is good, but they make you to get this paper every 24 hours to for a new password to login. It'd be easier if I just use one password for the entire stay. A good hotel to stay if you don't need much of their assistance or services. We also complained this situation to the manager, but she was very reluctant to solve any problems. At first she offered a free upgrade of the room for next time which costs them nothing and we didn't think we would want to stay in this hotel again. Therefore, we didn't like the resolution, so at the end she gave us a very small refund for not cleaning and making up the room. The service definitely needs more improvements.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: Gizmo2001
Reviews.Content: nice hotel with low prices. The room came with a menu, that wasn´t especially good. The breakfast is very simple, but overall the hotel is good at the price. Rooms are quite small, but the decor is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good - but service could be better”
Reviews.Author: Golben
Reviews.Content: Tripadvisor made us choose this hotel and we don't regret it - not too much anyway. There were a lot of positives in this fine hotel, but as with so many other things there's room for improvement. Positives: The free high speed internet. Location - near a not so crowded U-bahn station, Märkisches Musem - was central although not lively. The design was cool. The room - we stayed in an executive one - was great with a fantastic shower/bathtub. Also included was an Nespresso maker, nice touch, and air condition. Breakfast - a breakfast that has champagne is always a great one. Negatives: The service could be better. For example: I called housekeeping to ask for bathrobes and she couldn't speak English. And housekeeping - who knocked on the door and then entered without waiting - also threw away stuff we had wanted to keep. The girl in the reception forgot to call to tell us that our room was ready and she also forgot that she had ordered us a taxi. Breakfast was expensive: 17 Euro (although we got a voucher so we could eat for 13 Euro per person). The minibar was ridicolous. A 20 cl coke was 3,50 Euro.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet but Central to Historical Berlin”
Reviews.Author: buttons82
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days at the Park Plaza hotel and found it lovely. Along the street is a tube station and everyday we bought our breakfast (fresh pastries) from a nearby supermarket. Taking a right from the hotel and then the next left, 10 minutes walk takes you to the Berliner Dom straight ahead and to the right Alexander Platz. The hotel was modern and I like the wall street theme. We got the dollar bill carpet. The bath was HUGE and great for an evening soak after lots of walking. I loved the fruit cocktails in the bar, took ages to make but were a work of art when delivered to my table.

Reviews.Title: “cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: vag_gr
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable hotel. Big rooms, clean enough, good services, quiet and a nice bar! The right place to rest in the night after a day walking-sightseeing-shopping around berlin ! The area is really in the centre of the city (2-3 metro stations to alexanderplatz), very quiet in the night (offices, houses and embassies mostly). a good price as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, interesting design”
Reviews.Author: snoopy933
Reviews.Content: Used this as a base for sightseeing. Location was good - right between two U Bahn stops and within walking distance of lots of sights. Our maps were a bit misleading - looked too far to walk to places but actually we had no problem walking from here to the Brandenberg Gate etc & back. Location is quiet, but feels safe and tranquil. Room was OK - we got one with glass partitions for the bathroom area rather than it being a separate room, as mentioned in previous reviews - fine if you're not too embarrassed by bodily functions! Our friends' room had a "proper" en suite. Decor was stylish & functional. TV didn't work but I'm sure they would have done something about it if we had bothered to ask. Bar was expensive but had an extensive drinks menu and comfortable seating areas (gold & silver squashy armchairs & sofas!). Didn't feel rushed by the bar staff. Didn't try the restaurant, as there was so much to see in the city. Handy Milly's Cafe just around the corner serving a good choice of breakfasts. Plan to return to Berlin & would have no problem staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “I can really recommend it”
Reviews.Author: SterreS
Reviews.Content: Good hotel and not expensive. New hotel or recently refurbished. Room was not large, but really clean, bathroom was great. Location is close to a metrostation and 10 min. walk from Alexanderplatz.

Reviews.Title: “Design, location, value for money and design ... Did I mention design?”
Reviews.Author: Kent_o_Sigrid
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Park Plaza Wallstreet (located on Wallstrasse) in Berlin. The U-Bahn station is located close outside the building (about 100 m). With the U-Bahn and a connecting bus (X9) you get all the way to/from Berlin Tegel within 45 minutes and just 2,10 Euro (single trip p.p.). You can also reach many of the city's attractions from this U-Bahn station (called: Märkisches Museum) with good frequency even at late hours. When you enter the hotel you immediately notice that this hotel is a lot about design. The reception, the bar area, the rooms, almost everything is inspired by the Wall street/money theme. The room was designed in a modern fashion. The most noticeable things were probably: 1. The carpet with a One USD bill pattern. 2. The bathroom behind glass walls with bamboo pattern. 3. The end of the bed including cupboards and a “word of wisdom”. The room, as well as the hotel as a whole, felt very new, fresh and clean. After staying at another hotel for our first two nights in Berlin this room felt considerably smaller. However this was a standard room compared to an “upscale room” at the other hotel. The room was still big enough (great height!) and had all amenities we required (like flat screen TV, AC, safe, fridge/mini bar, Coffee and tea maker). The only thing we would complain about was that the glass door to the bathroom did not close properly resulting in a lack of privacy. Nice staff. Relatively central, but quite location. A short walk to some of the many attractions like Alexanderplatz, Pergamon museum, Unter den Linden (all within 15 min walk) and otherwise there is always the U-Bahn (direct connection to the Zoologischer Garten). A good Indian restaurant with lunch for 5,90 € between 11 - 16 is located at the river just around the corner. More local pubs are close by to the river. The breakfast buffet was rather expensive so we had our breakfast in the city center for half the money. The room itself was very nicely priced at less than 75 €. We would stay here again and recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location!”
Reviews.Author: Bielefeldkim
Reviews.Content: A group of 6 of us recently stayed at the Park Plaza. Aside from breakfast not being included in the stay (and ridiculously expensive) and also the cost of drinks in the bar (also ridiculously expensive!!) we couldn't really fault this hotel. The room was perfectly adequate for a short say (not really enough wardrobe/cupboard space for a long stay), we had a 'wet-room' shower which was excellent. The hotel itself is brilliantly located. On day 1 we walked for approx 5 minutes down to the river Spree and had a lovely lunch in one of the many restuarants along the river bank. We alternated between walking to Alexander Platz (20 mins) or catching the u-bahn which is literally a 2 min walk from the hotel, for 2 stops. On our last evening we walked in the direction of Alexander Platz to Poststr which took about 8 mins and had a lovely meal in a really charming "village" setting overlooking a park. I can't understand anybody who would say this hotel is not really well located because IT IS!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - weird bathroom”
Reviews.Author: JP40Norfolk
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my boyfriend. Location is ok, about 20 minute walk to alexander platz but right next to two U-bahn stops. Quite location, no bars or resturants that we found near by. The only down side was the bathroom only had a screen between the room and the toilet (no door!) embarassing when staying with other half!!

Reviews.Title: “Great!Modern&excellent location,quite”
Reviews.Author: joye_7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right next to a metro (U) station (Markishes Museum) in the central line (U2).Very convinient location. Althought the breakfast was expensive (17 euro pp).We took the metro 5 stations to Potsdam platz (highly recommended the brewery inside Sony Center) and had breakfast at Starbucks with less than half of the money.Very modern and clean.Alhtought a bit small room but it was ok.Very quite and free internet in the room.In general Berlin is very exciting.Don´t miss a guided tour in Sachenhausen concentration camp just outside berlin and also Sansousi Palace in Potsdam city. Kudamm (as they call Kurfusterndam strasse) has many shops in reasonable prices. try to find a shopping guide leaflet at your hotel. It is like a shop map!Go for a walk in Hackecher mark in the evening. Just undeneath the train station there are several cosy restaurants and pubs. Metro closes at midnight but Friday&Saturday they work 24 hrs.Great experience.Modern city with a lot of history.A MUST for those who like learning and having great time at the same time.Enoy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: ericmuli
Reviews.Content: The Hotel position was quite good,in quite neighborhood but near there is a Ubahn that can take you to every place.the room was good,not big enough,very new and comfortable. the stuff was excellent and very helpful. The only thing is that the breakfast is very expensive (17 euro) and there is no free parking

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is ridiculous, both in a good and bad way”
Reviews.Author: Ashley2022
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and have a lot to say. Positives: 1. Great theme. The rooms are fabulously modern and all nicely decorated (if you like money and modern decor). 2. Very safe (read boring) location right beside UBahn stop. 3. Friendly helpful staff Negatives: 1. NOTHING was included and everything was wildly overpriced. Breakfast was 17 euros EACH! This is hard to swallow when a free breakfast is so common in European hotels. They don't even offer free internet access which is just poor customer service, especially for a business class hotel. The hotel restaurant and bar were frighteningly expensive. Overall, you could easily pay the same amount for a better location with more amenities. Keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive but out of the way”
Reviews.Author: CML_2009
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a few nights. The rooms were very clean and nicely decorated. The bar and restaurant were also a nice addition although a bit expensive. If you are looking to stay in a residential neighborhood off of the beaten path this place is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good but I am sure you can do better in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: mvr
Reviews.Content: The room was not very large but has all the basics are there if you are on a business trip. Wireless access on Swisscom which was very expensive, there was however free access in the lobby. Breakfast was the only meal that I had there it was not very German in feel and was fairly basic overall. The bar by the lobby is fairly trendy and was playing some good music but there was not a lot of room to sit and chat if you were in a large group. Overall the stay was good but I am sure there are better hotels in Berlin for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms - isolated location”
Reviews.Author: JCLON
Reviews.Content: This themed hotel is a little disappointing. The rooms are small, the bathroom amenities are "cheap." The furtniture is made of plain white plywood... Breakfast is standard, and certainly disappointing compared to the usual lavish german breakfasts. Although the hotel is in Mitte, it is in a very remote location.

Reviews.Title: “Descent but not my first choice”
Reviews.Author: Tipana
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not ideally located but it is in a quiet neighborhood and the underground does stop right in front. The rooms were well kept, there was pleanty of closet space and the bed was roomy enough for two. The bathroom was spacious and always clean with fresh towels available. The breakfast was exepensive if you chose to eat at the restaurant downstairs and the internet was at an extra cost. Our secret pleasure was the availbility of a gym and sauna on the ground floor. Overall, our stay was pleasant but due to extra costs and its location, will not make this hotel my first choice during our next visit

Reviews.Title: “Company Annual Meeting - good overall experience”
Reviews.Author: FCCCLisbon
Reviews.Content: I booked my company's annual meeting in Berlin. We were 65 persons. After comparing several hotels, we got the best deal with Wall Street Plaza, since they offered a very good price for the business package/room (conference room, coffee breaks, lunch and room). We had a very good experience, since the hotel is modern, clean, central (with a metro station a few steps) and food was good. The staff is regular, not very kind, but professional. We stayed 4 days, 2 working days, and 2 leisure days. Everybody enjoyed very much the meeiting, the city and the hotel. We recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: ostan14
Reviews.Content: Very happy with my recent stay at the Park Plaza Wallstreet. We found the hotel very easy to find from Schonefeld Airport. We took the S-bahn to Alexanderplatz and then got the underground line U2 to the Märkisches Museum. As another reviewer pointed out, when you get off the train, turn right, and when you exit the underground station the hotel is across the road on your left hand side. The reception staff were very friendly, and we asked and got a quiet room on the second floor. The room was fine, very modern, bedding very European - 2 single duvets on double bed - but we were a bit disappointed by the room size. It was on the small size. But as we didn't plan on spending much time in the room, it did the job. Bathroom was curiously almost as big as the bedroom, and again is very modern and bright. We had a few drinks in the bar on one of the evenings, and found the staff very friendly and professional. The bar and lobby area is also the only place were free WIFI is available. I find it strange that many modern hotels still insist on charging for Internet usage in guest rooms. It smacks of greed, and for me leaves a feeling of being taken for a mug! I found the hotel location to be very central, after all it is not even a ten minute stroll from Alexanderplatz and there are plenty of restaurants and bars in that area. Also the huge 3 storey Alexa shopping centre is located there. As another reviewer pointed out, there are Lidl and Plus supermarkets located at the back of the hotel, through the courtyard - handy for picking up a few beers or wine for drinking in the room. I would recommend the Park Plaza Wall Street to anyone looking for clean, funky, central accommodation at a very reasonable cost in the former Eastern part of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “A decent experience”
Reviews.Author: Issyk-Kul
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights at the Park Plaza in Wallstrasse. The location was a plus for me, as the hotel was close to the place I had to go during the day. Otherwhise, the surroundings aren't that exciting - even though it is in the middle of Berlin it's not really in an area with a lot of animation. On the other hand it is not far from Gendarmenmarkt, one of the nicest squares in town. The staff was nice and service-oriented, especially at the reception. Very good. The room - on the second floor - was still newish, with high ceilings and the stock exchange decor much discussed by other reviewers. I found it fun, though maybe not really appropriate in today's financial crisis. Anyway. The bedding was of good quality and I had a good sleep. The bathroom (with a shower) was also good, even though it had a rather strange configuration .... the shower was almost as big as the rest of the bathroom. But this was probably due to the fact that the hotel was built into a converted building. Breakfast (which was included in the room price) was more than appropriate, in a veranda in the second courtyard. I did not eat at the hotel, but had a drink at the bar, which was stylish, but - don't ask me why - was not very cosy. It gave me the impression of a Soviet sanatorium lobby. Not a place to spend the whole night for sure. Finally, the free wifi (as advertised on the webpage) was only available in the lobby. Strange, as internet in the room was extremely expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel but dinner seriously overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Gavibabes
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel last week and though the room was fairly small it was clean, warm and decorated nicely. We opted for a room only rate as breakfast seemed a bit expensive at €18 per person. On our second night we had dinner in the hotel which was a big let down. We paid €25 for a Fillet steak which did not come with anything, chips, side salad, potato, pepper sauce etc. had to be ordered seperately and obviously you were charged. But the big disappointment was the size of the steak. It was tiny !!!! Our bill for one soup, two steaks with sides and one dessert and 3 drinks came to €105. Big Rip Off. Lovely hotel but dont eat here spend your money wisely somewhere else....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel which made our stay.”
Reviews.Author: Eurokatbam
Reviews.Content: My partner and I decided to go to Berlin for the Christmas week, and I booked the Wall Street Park Plaza on Travelocity a few months ago (having read the reviews on Tripadvisor) - a superior room for an amazing price of £48 per room per night (I think there was a special offer on). It was particularly important to us that we had a good hotel, as we'd saved up for some time for the trip and were hoping to make it one to remember - we weren't disappointed! The hotel is very practically located, about two minutes walk from the Spittelmarkt U-Bahn station - this is on line 2 of the U-Bahn, which is ideal for visitors at it offers a direct route to Alexanderplatz, Stadtmitte, Potsdamer Platz and Wittenbergplatz etc. The hotel's also only about 10-15 minutes walk away from Alexander Platz. The room was great - very spacious, with a high ceiling and very large windows. The decor was unusual and modern (a nice change to the identical hotel rooms that you find in most hotel chains), the bed was very comfy and the room was spotlessly clean. The bathroom had a modern walk-in shower. The room had all the necessary mod-cons, including safe, hairdryer, flat-screen TV (which could be used to browse the internet for an extra fee), minibar, iron and board and espresso making machine. The staff were all extremely professional, friendly and fluent in English. Although we didn't drink in the bar, it certainly looked very well-stocked! We also didn't eat at the hotel, but did have a snoop round the breakfast room, which looked very pleasant and airy! The hotel was also very quiet - we were hardly aware of any other guests, and Wallstrasse itself is very quiet. All in all, I'd really recommend this hotel to anyone - it offered everything we needed and much more (for an extremely reasonable price) and ensured that we had a perfect Christmas trip.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds & attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: LMC_77
Reviews.Content: We booked a 3 night midweek stay in a superior room directly through the hotel website which averaged at 71 euros a night, excluding breakfast. We booked on the basis of the very favourable reviews on the website and they weren't wrong! Once we located the hotel (after walking out of the opposite exit of the underground station!), we were checked in quickly and given room 132 on the first floor. The room was airy and clean, but right next door to the lift. Once we realised this, I called down to reception to inquire about moving rooms. The receptionist was very helpful and quickly moved us to room 111 on the other side of the hotel (a long way from the lift). I think we were upgraded to an Executive Room as the new room had a great bathtub, rather than just a shower! To echo other people's comments - the beds were very comfortable and the hotel was quiet at night - the best recipe for a good night's sleep! The bathtub was also full-sized and very deep - good for soaking in after a day of trekking round the sights. We did not have breakfast at the hotel but opted to grab breads/pastries/coffee from the many food-outlets in the main stations. The hotel is located in a quiet, but central part of Mitte - there is nothing in the way of nightlife close by, but is only 5 minutes by underground/15 minutes walk to Alexanderplatz. TOP TIP: If you are arriving by underground line U2 from Alexanderplatz, you need to exit the station in the direction of the train to ensure you end up facing the hotel! The hotel is actually about a minutes walk from the station on the left hand side of the road.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant city and great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Amydotliz
Reviews.Content: We booked via Last Minute.com, but word to the wise, book directly on the hotel website for the best prices. This is a fantastic value hotel and in easy distance of all the main things you will want to see in Berlin. We walked to The Reichstag, The Brandenberg Gate, and Alexanderplatz with the TV Tower. Other reviewers have commented on the price of the breakfast buffet. I can't add to this as we didn't breakfast at the hotel, however, if it does look a little steep, we found a fantastic little cafe called Millies Cafe, less than 10 minutes walk away (on the corner of Gertraudenstrasse and Fischerinsel) which did a range of breakfasts; from the French (consisting of croissants and marmalade) for under 5 euros, to the biggie, a Millies Breakfast (including yoghurt, four bread rolls, salad, boiled egg, smoked salmon, meats and cheeses) for less than 8 euros, and very nice too! They also served a great coffee were friendly and helpful and had an impressive and delicious looking array of cakes and pastries on offer. But back to the hotel. Our room was all we could have asked for: quiet, comfortable, spacious, warm. The bathroom was brilliant with a lovely wet room style shower and modern fittings. The bed was very comfortable too. The only issue we found was with the tea/coffe making facilities, where there was only powdered milk available, which, rather than mixing nicely into my coffee turned into lumps and spoiled it, however this is such a minor point, and other reviewers have offered tips on where to go to buy your own proper milk, so no biggie. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly and the bar was a lovely relaxing haven to enjoy a nightcap, with excellent bar - tenders and an extraordinary array of spirits!

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hanrach
Reviews.Content: This hotel is superbly situated in the Mitte District of Berlin. It is about 10 minutes walk to Alexanderplatz, the old beating heart of pre war Berlin now a showcase for the socilaist period. You can pretty much walk anywhere from here. The newly constructed Potsdammer Platz with its Sony Centre are about 15 minutes away. However, there is an underground station less than 1 minute away which is one of the central routes from where you can get to Friedrichstrasse in less than 10 minutes. The hotel is superb. The superior rooms while not overly big are carpeted with a huge impression of a dollar bill. The breakfast was more than one could ask for and beyond the usual, albeit delicious, meat, cheese fruit selection. There were many small nice touches. The hotel staff could not have been more helpful including checking train times for us to the airport. Berlin is a gem of a city and has to be visited. The eastern sector of the city, in my view, has the best of the city and has been well maintained. From this hotel, all of these sites are no more than 10 minutes walk: Unter den Linden, Alexanderplatz, the TV Tower. From here one can promenade (Bummel) down the UdL to the Brandenburg Gate and experience that boulevard as others did many years ago. I have stayed in many hotels in Berlin and on Friedrichstrasse but for location and value for money this hotel is now my hotel of choice. For 3 nights we paid 192 Euros: a snip in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: OrganizedTourist
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a short weekend trip. While the location is a little further from the main sites, the hotel is great and such a great value! We loved the modern decor in the rooms and bathrooms. The rooms have a very high ceiling which is great! It was extremely clean and everything seemed new. We didn't get a chance to eat at the hotel for breakfast but from what we saw it looked good! Overall, a great hotel for the money!!

Reviews.Title: “Smart hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: HonoraryAussies
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel with a difference, not your usual run of the mill motel type accommodation! The bedrooms are spacious and modern with LCD TV and internet access (if prepared to pay). Good value at just over £50 pn. Didn't eat at the hotel because of reports on this site as to cost. However, if you are prepared to walk just beyond the Maerkisches Museum at the end of the street you will alight upon perhaps the best value charecter restaurant in the city - das Marinehaus - situated across the road from the riverbank. They do a 2 course dinner from 9.60E. Around the first corner in the opposite direction is a Spanish bodega offering tapas and a left turn at the U-bahn station finds an Indian restaurant. Just behind the hotel is a smart deli that does cheap and cheerful breakfast fare. Don't miss das Maerkisches Museum, which features striking displays on the history of lighting.

Reviews.Title: “A great deal and a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Loda-Braida
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via my travel card based on the Trip Advisor reviews and was not disappointed. In fact, I was just thrilled. Travelling there after the Frankfurt Book Fair, I checked in before meeting my friend from Holland at the impressive new Hauptbahnhof (main railway station). It's a restored and completely renovated hotel. The theme is Wall Street - down to the stock quotes on the hallway carpets. Our room was so wonderful, very modern, delightfully so, spacious, and very clean. And given the up and down in the stock market these days, the quote on the wall above the bed, was a bit of black humour. We shared a superior room facing the street. The area is very quiet and if you had a mind to, you could easily walk to Museum Island in 15-20 mins. But the bus and underground are right there too. the breakfast buffet, while good, is a bit overpriced at 17 euro! And dinner was a bit sad at the restaurant. We were the only ones there. The one drawback for some maybe the lack of night life or restaurants and cafes. But the area is on the way up and I think there will be more action soon . Berlin is a fabulous city and at 74 euro a night, this was a fabulous find.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful wallstreet”
Reviews.Author: essieHolland
Reviews.Content: a short stay in the park plaza wallstreet. excellent location for visiting berlin mitte. A beautiful ancient building (formerly a trade house), but the inside is modern and very comfortable. Especially the nespresso machines for making coffee in the executive room was a nice touch. Breakfast very tastefull especially the bircher muesli. friendly and capable hardworking staff. Once and a while I missed the smile.

Reviews.Title: “Wunderbar Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveller0859
Reviews.Content: This is by far one of the best hotels in it's grade in Berlin. Reading other reviews here people have complianed that it is not exactly central, well that is to it's advantage. The hotel is within comfortable walking distance of the majority of visitor sites, even the Zoo is walkable if you don't mind an hours walk, which we didn't. And what a Zoo it is, it leaves UK Zoo's wanting. The staff at the hotel are great, especially the bar staff who are extremely friendly and all speak very good english. There have been other people who complained about the cost of breakfast at the hotel, we didn't have breakfast but we did have a couple of evening meals and with a Steak at 16 Euros and a Burger meal at 13 Euros, the prices are very similar to those of a pub in the UK but of better quality, so I can't imagine the cost of the breakfast being too over the top and you do appear to get a lot for your money. We had breakfast at a hotel in France a couple of weeks ago and we got very little for our 10.50E. The rooms in the hotel are excellent, not many hotels give you two chairs and a table, they expect everybody to sit on the bed to watch TV etc, but not the Park Plaza. It is very easy to get to the hotel too. From Schonefeld Airport, take the S-bahn to Alexanderplatz (direction of Spandau). Get off and get onto the Underground U2 ( direction "Ruhleben")to "Märkisches Museum" which is 2 stops. As you get off the train go right to the exit and go up the steps.Walk straight forward across the road and you will soon see the The Golden Buddy-Bear. The hotel bar opens until 1am, obviously if it is not too busy they will close earlier but in the five nights we were there they were open from 11am until 1am. The rooms have hair dryers, which my wife found to be excellent as it is an actual hand held dryer so you have control over the temperature and not the constant heat which you get from those units which are stuck to the wall in other hotels. If like me you enjoy your cups of tea, the cups in the rooms are small mugs and not the two sip cups as in other hotels. If you go out of the hotel through the court yard you will find a Lidl to your right where you can buy milk and keep it in your mini bar fridge. We found our first Berlin experience great, made all the better by the comfort of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent holiday”
Reviews.Author: phil38
Reviews.Content: Very well situated hotel, 2 minutes from Markisches Museum underground, which is 3 stations from Alexander Platz, from whwer you can catch the train to lots of places.We went to Frankfurt Oder and walked into Poland, just over the river - very interesting day trip, one hour from Berlin. It was also easy to walk to lots of places in Berlin from the hotel. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful; I forgot something in the hotel safe and they sent it on to me immediately. Room was large and comfortable, as was the bathroom, spotless and relaxing. There was a bar and restaurant but we didn't use them; they were attractively decorated. One of the best hotels we have stayed in and this contributed to a very successful week in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: jo-jo-josie
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd year we have stayed in Berlin for the beer festival, and this hotel was by far the best we have stayed in. Fabulous theme - Wall street. Well comfy beds, iron, hairdryer, funky coffee machine, well stocked bar down stairs. It is 2 minutes walk from the U Bahn, very good bus service around the corner. Well informed reception desk. Near to other restaurants. Will be back here next year!

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: el_roquero
Reviews.Content: Quite clean hotel. It is within walking distance to the Museums island, the Berlin Dome and the eastern end of Unter der Linden, Berlin's most historical area. U-Bahn (Berlin's subway/metro) station is almost at the door of the hotel and a direct line takes you to the Potsdamplatz, one of the chique's areas in town, with restaurants, shops, Berlin Philharmonie hall, Legoland, etc. One metro connection from Potsdamplaz gets you to the Brandenburg gate, while you can also walk from Potsdamplatz to there or the Reichtag. My room was clean and had fast Internet access. The staff did their duties well, while I wouldn't call them "friendly". I took a cab to Tegel airport, which I think cost me ~25 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: milothedogg
Reviews.Content: this is a fantastic well designed and comfortable hotel. the location is very handy for all your sightseeing needs the desk staff are fantastic and helpfull this hotel is a hidden gem at a very reasonable rate on the park plaza website

Reviews.Title: “Park Plaza....A nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Tonyeng
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at the park plaza. It is a new and stylish hotel, Clean, comfortable beds and nice bathroom with great shower. Staff polite and very helpful. Convenient for location. The street which the hotel is on is quiet, a bit out of the centre. Really enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “the award for best carpet goes to the Plaza!”
Reviews.Author: happycamper83
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in the Park Plaza. It was a good location for access to the underground but the area itself was pretty quiet - that didn't bother us as the transport system was so good and it didn't take long to get to other areas. The staff on the desk were helpful and were happy to find things out for us on the internet. It was a nice place to stay with not much to dislike. We changed from our first room which seemed a bit dusty and not 100% clean but our second room was fine and there was no bother in changing. Really nice bathroom with a great walk in shower. It cost about 23 euros by taxi to get to the hotel from tegel airport which we were told was the best mode of transport to use as the public transport was not very direct. I loved Berlin and all the walking around meant that I was glad to come back each night to a comfortable bed and nice place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the park plaza wallstreet, loved berlin.”
Reviews.Author: superlambbanana100
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at the park plaza, very new and stylish hotel, their website photos are true to reality. Very clean, very comfortable beds and cool bathrooms (great shower). Staff very polite and helpful. Didn't try the restaurant, but the bar was very chilled out. Convenient for U-bahn - half way between Spittelmarkt and Markisches Museum stations. The street which the hotel is on is quiet, a bit out of the centre. All in all really enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Ab-Fab stay at PPW.”
Reviews.Author: Schleins Girl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I, together with another couple, stayed for 3 nights in february. And we had a lovely stay at the Park Plaza Wallstreet. We were in room 412 and room 414. Room 414 was kind of cosier than 412, but room 412 had a HUGE bathroom with a tub. Both rooms were super-clean, had very comfortable beds and were well appointed. We had breakfast once at the hotel and it was buffet-style, with the biggest variety of food i have ever seen at a hotel. The hotel is 1 minute away from Märkiches Museum train station, with the U2-line, witch takes you to some of the biggest sights in Berlin. All in all, a very nice stay at the PPW, would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: gregoryrobbo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Plaza for a week in December. We got a superior room at a great price through Hotels.com. The hotel is very modern, but the 'Wall Street' theme gives a little more character than most large chain hotels. Our room was of a good size - not huge, but certainly roomy enough for two of us for a week. Location is pretty good, not directly in the middle of tourist areas, but close enough to walk to most. U-Bahn is one minute from hotel and will take you anywhere. Recommend visitors to Berlin buy a travel pass, which will then allow you to travel anywhere in the city - great value for money. All hotel staff we came into contact with were very pleasant. Had a problem with our travel adapter and assistant manager and maintenance person both arrived at room very quickly to remedy. Reception staff in particular very friendly. We only had breakfast on our last morning. Like most chain hotels, this was certainly overpriced, particularly for a city where we found prices very reasonable. We had room service one night and were happy with the burger & chips, service and price. Overall, I would recommend the Park Plaza. Berlin is a fantastic city, loads to see and do. Visiting in December allowed us to visit the Christmas markets which were fantastic, and the best of which were within walking distance of the hotel. I would recommend the Park Plaza as a base for touring Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel...”
Reviews.Author: volcomcito
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Park Plaza Wallstreet Berlin from January 16-22. the cab from TXL is 21euros. staff was very helpful regarding restaurants, washing centers and internet cafe. hotel room is minimalistic but very cool. the GW carpet is nice, as well as the bathroom and tub. we had room 501 and it was quiet during nights... we opted for the 24hrs internet access for 17euros the last night of our stay, so we can stay in touch with our family and check in for our flights from our room. the U-Bahn station (markishes museum) is just 45 seconds from the hotel front door. from that (U2 Line) you can go anywhere in Berlin.. we also used the sauna, and it was good. I would recommend staying here if you find a great deal. we went to the supermarket in Alexa shopping center and stock up our mini fridge with breakfast, water, juice, yogurt, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Overall enjoyed the Stay”
Reviews.Author: eader
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel on the strength of reviews on trip advisor. Myself and my girlfriend stayed here for 5 nights over the New Years. We had some good experiences and also some concerns during our stay, which are as follows: Good 1. Very close to two underground stations, less that 1 minute walk. (its on the u2 red line) 2. Excellent location, about 15-20 min walk to the Brandendurgh gate/Tor. About 6 minutes to Unter den Linden 3. We were upgraded free of charge to a suite. This room was spacious and bright and decorated in a modern "wallstreet" style. The bathroom was also spacious, shower pressure was excellent and the bath was bigger than usual. 4. All hotel employees that we dealt with had good conversational english. Bad 1. Breakfast price was not included in the room price and this was not made clear during the booking process. 2. 17euro for breakfast per-person is excessive in a relatively low cost city. 3. Room service is exceptionally weak. One night ice was ordered but not delivered. The following night more room service was ordered from an exceptionally weak menu (the menu had no main course, two starters, four sandwich options, one salad option and one desert option, and stops serving at 11pm). At least a quarter of the listed menu was not available when we called. Ice this time was delivered but we only got 5 ice-cubes in a smal glass. Must not have heard of an ice-bucket? 4. Bar atmosphere was atrocious, there was barely 15 people there over the course of 5 nights. 5. The room was frequently cold, although on closer inspection we could adjust the heaters. Finally, the age old question, would we stay here again? The answer is yes, however I would first check other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yezzie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel 23 November-26 November and we (me and my boyfriend) had a pleasant time there. The hotel is above average; very nice and modern rooms. Our bed was really comfortable (just like the pillows), not like other hotels in same price range. We acutally had read here on Tripadvisor about the so called bathroom, but we didn't think it was that open and not soundproof as it was. But after a while we actually got used to it. Liked the area; close to both one thing and the other. Within walking distance to Brandenburger Gate, Chechpoint Charlie and the TV tower. I would definitely recommend it to other persons.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel shame about the food”
Reviews.Author: aquakem
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the park plaza for a break from life mini break. The hotel was modern very clean and the staff very attentive. The room was upgraded for us as we only booked a standard room so we had a seperate bathroom (which judging from the other reviews is a bonus!!). The room was freezing though and when we put heating on the cleaner turned it down when sprucing up the room (sorry but my feet cared little for their carbon footprint). My only warning is the food at the number 23 at the Hotel, it was awful (breakfast is nice, buffet) think they were trying too hard , far too hard. Cannot however fault the staff. As we were only there for a couple of days we took taxis everywhere which is okay but there is loads to see and do great city but spread out with no one paticular centre. Love Berlin and Berliners tend not to be as stuck up as other city dwellers so thoroughly all round great trip.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: roundy77
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. Room nice, big, fresh and clean. Just what you need after a day on the go. Staff were good, especially the bar staff who made good recommendations for restaurants to visit. The breakfast was excellent, lots of choice too. The location is good, within walking distance of lots of areas of interest. Also very near the underground station. Would definitley visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Toilet flushing in the bed”
Reviews.Author: Venezia7
Reviews.Content: We had booked a room here for 3 nights, we only stayed 1 night, we couldn't have stayed one second more, even though it was prepaid and no money back! The construction of the rooms are such that the toilet with a glass door with a big "modern" hole in it, flushes exactly beside the bed which is situated less than app 40 cm from the mentioned glass door. The room had a tacky decor and had morning sun which heated the room totally even though we had the blinds down etc etc - a horrible experience. However, we were so lucky to get a room at another small hotel in Berlin, which opened just 6 weeks ago, this hotel had a so called open bathroom BUT with a seperate toilet with a door you could close, and we managed to save the holiday ;)

Reviews.Title: “Smart nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Magjias
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Park Plaza Wallstreet hotel from March 30 to April 4, 2007 and we really enjoyed it! It is located in Mitte, in the heart of the city and there is an underground station just 50m from the hotel. The rooms are nice, modern, clean with a smart design and very very quite. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel as it was too expensive for us but near the hotel there is a good bakery and a big discount store (Lidl). They are in the street placed parallel to the entrance of the hotel. I suggest you to have a sauna on the ground floor of the hotel; it is really helpful after a day of walking around the city and there are always few people (actually we met a girl just one of the three day we had a sauna). We really enjoyed our stay in Berlin (a beautiful, modern, tolerant, cheap and interesting city) thanks also to this smart hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Gets a big tick from us...”
Reviews.Author: TaveLondon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for long weekend (3 nights) in April 2007. The hotel was really great & I would highly recommend it. The staff were very friendly, especially the bar staff.....they make a mean G&T! The rooms are very modern, spacious & clean with very comfy beds. Our room was at the back of the hotel, which we liked as it was very quiet. Location wise, whilst it is located in a business district it's still very central, it's on a quiet road, you can walk to most places and for those places further afield, it's in the middle of two Ubahn stations. The bar is good for a drink either before or after your evening out (stays open till the early hours) and the music was good...house/chill out but not too loud i.e. you can still have a conversation. Can't comment on the food as we didn't eat there but the restaurant was a big, bright and airy space. All in all we gave the hotel a big tick!

Reviews.Title: “Really good!”
Reviews.Author: Patxi
Reviews.Content: The Wallstreet Hotel is an excellent option if you want a smart and clean hotel in Berlin. Location is not the best, but a U-Banh (underground) station is front the hotel, so you will spend no more than 15" to Postdamer Platz or 10" to Alexander Platz. Neighbourhood is very quiet with some close restaurants. Our room was quite nice, comfortable and sunny. I did not find any weak point in the Hotel. I recommend it, sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: TrishBrady
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel and great value we paid 280 Euros for 3 nights for a double room. Its located in a quiet area but near 2 U stations which can bring you into the heart of things. As other reviews have said freidstrasse is within 15 minute walk and have great shops! Irish Bar was DEAD, didnt even show the rubgy! Maybe we just unlucky but wouldnt go back in. Would recommend you get the U to Potsdamer Platz as there are so many restaurants and bars to choose from, atmosphere is great too. We ate in a Mexican and an Italian called Essence and both were really good. Berlin is a great city we walked up to the Museum quarter and then down to Check Point Charlie and the Brandenberg gate. Queued for ages for The Reichstag building... I mean ages almost 1.5 hours in the freezing cold. It wasnt worth it... if there is a queue dont bother!! Sorry ;-) Would recommend the hotel, our room was huge. Down side bed was like a brick, but our friends had a comfy bed. Breakfast is expensive we didnt eat here we went out and got it cheaper... but its supposed to be yummy. All in all would stay there again as it was great value and a lovely hotel... Berlin is great fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: road2
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked this hotel in advance for only 67euro a night! The value of the place, for that price was amazing. It is a very clean and comfortable hotel, especially for a young couple like us who usually rough it a bit more. The staff was very friendly and as long as you put a 'do not disturb' sign on your door, you shouldn't be bothered with the cleaning service until after you leave for the day. We got in late our first night and so went down the road to the irish bar, which was the only place serving after 10:30pm. it was decent. another night, we wanted a little snack before dinner, so we walked through the courtyard to the lidl supermarket to grab something and that was very convenient. The location of the hotel is perfect. Right between 2 metro stops and in easy walking distance to the 'center'. It was very quiet in our room, too. I highly recommend this hotel, if you can get that great deal as well! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel Superb Value!”
Reviews.Author: joanoArmagh
Reviews.Content: Just returned from two night stay in Park Pllaza Berlin. Immaculate facilities. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Central location, close to undreground. (All day ticket 5.20 euro zone A and B Great value. ) Underground not disable friendly, some lifts and escalators but not always! Breakfast cost 16euro but worth it. Very good standard lots of choice. Excellent service, .Everything seemed new and fresh.. Alcohol was expensive in hotel bar. Would def recommend this hotel for city break. Great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful wallstreet”
Reviews.Author: deetravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in early December to take in the Christmas markets etc. The hotel had a great location; easy walking distance to Checkpoint Charlie, Museum Island, Friedrichstraße, Unter den Linden. There is also U-bahn stations close by to the Hotel. The Hotel is modern and chic, yet retro and comfortable. The rooms are great with a fabulous walk in shower The staff were friendly with very good English and always helpful. We had room service on the first night and if it wasn't for all the goodies at the markets would probably have eaten in again! Most definitely recommend.

HotelInfo.Name: Park Plaza Wallstreet Berlin
HotelInfo.Address: Wallstrasse 23 - 24, 10179 Berlin, Germany
